sentences.zh: 孔子生魯昌平鄉陬邑。

translations.literal: Confucius was born in Zouyi village, Changping township of Lu.

sentences.zh: 其先宋人也，曰孔防叔。

translations.literal: His ancestors were from Song, named Kong Fangshu.

sentences.zh: 防叔生伯夏，伯夏生叔梁紇。

translations.literal: Fangshu fathered Bo Xia, Bo Xia fathered Shu Liang He.

sentences.zh: 紇與顏氏女野合而生孔子，禱於尼丘得孔子。

translations.literal: He mated with a Yan family woman out of wedlock and gave birth to Confucius, having prayed at Ni Hill to obtain Confucius.

sentences.zh: 魯襄公二十二年而孔子生。

translations.literal: Confucius was born in the twenty-second year of Duke Xiang of Lu.

sentences.zh: 生而首上圩頂，故因名曰丘云。

translations.literal: He was born with a sunken fontanelle on top of his head, so he was named Qiu accordingly.

sentences.zh: 字仲尼，姓孔氏。

translations.literal: His courtesy name was Zhong Ni, surname Kong.

Confucius was born in Zouyi village, Changping township of Lu. His ancestors were from Song, named Kong Fangshu. Fangshu fathered Bo Xia, Bo Xia fathered Shu Liang He. He mated with a Yan family woman out of wedlock and gave birth to Confucius, having prayed at Ni Hill to obtain Confucius. Confucius was born in the twenty-second year of Duke Xiang of Lu. He was born with a sunken fontanelle on top of his head, so he was named Qiu accordingly. His courtesy name was Zhong Ni, surname Kong.

sentences.zh: 丘生而叔梁紇死，葬於防山。

translations.literal: Qiu was born and Shu Liang He died, buried at Fang Mountain.

sentences.zh: 防山在魯東，由是孔子疑其父墓處，母諱之也。

translations.literal: Fang Mountain is east of Lu, so Confucius doubted the location of his father's grave, because his mother kept it secret.

sentences.zh: 孔子為兒嬉戲，常陳俎豆，設禮容。

translations.literal: When Confucius was a child at play, he would always arrange the sacrificial stands and assume ritual postures.

sentences.zh: 孔子母死，乃殯五父之衢，蓋其慎也。

translations.literal: When Confucius's mother died, he held the funeral at Wufu crossroads, showing his caution.

sentences.zh: 郰人輓父之母誨孔子父墓，然後往合葬於防焉。

translations.literal: A Zou person, the mother of Ran You's father, informed Confucius of his father's grave, then he went and joined the burial at Fang.

Qiu was born and Shu Liang He died, buried at Fang Mountain. Fang Mountain is east of Lu, so Confucius doubted the location of his father's grave, because his mother kept it secret. When Confucius was a child at play, he would always arrange the sacrificial stands and assume ritual postures. When Confucius's mother died, he held the funeral at Wufu crossroads, showing his caution. A Zou person, the mother of Ran You's father, informed Confucius of his father's grave, then he went and joined the burial at Fang.

sentences.zh: 孔子要絰，季氏饗士，孔子與往。

translations.literal: Confucius was in mourning attire when the Ji family feasted the scholars, and Confucius went along.

sentences.zh: 陽虎絀曰：「季氏饗士，非敢饗子也。」

translations.literal: Yang Hu rebuked him saying: 'The Ji family feasts the scholars, not daring to feast you.'

sentences.zh: 孔子由是退。

translations.literal: Confucius thus withdrew.

Confucius was in mourning attire when the Ji family feasted the scholars, and Confucius went along. Yang Hu rebuked him saying: 'The Ji family feasts the scholars, not daring to feast you.' Confucius thus withdrew.

sentences.zh: 孔子年十七，魯大夫孟釐子病且死，誡其嗣懿子曰：「孔丘，聖人之後，滅於宋。

translations.literal: At age seventeen, Lu minister Meng Xi Zi was ill and near death, admonishing his heir Yi Zi saying: 'Kong Qiu is a descendant of sages, extinguished in Song.

sentences.zh: 其祖弗父何始有宋而嗣讓厲公。

translations.literal: His ancestor Fu Fu He first had Song but yielded to Li Gong.

sentences.zh: 及正考父佐戴、武、宣公，三命茲益恭，故鼎銘云：『一命而僂，再命而傴，三命而俯，循墻而走，亦莫敢余侮。

translations.literal: And Zheng Kao Fu assisted Dai, Wu, and Xuan Gong, three summons becoming increasingly respectful, hence the ding inscription says: "One summons and bent, two summons and bowed, three summons and prostrated, following the wall and running, none dare insult me.

sentences.zh: 饘於是，粥於是，以餬余口。』

translations.literal: Rice here, gruel here, to fill my mouth."'

sentences.zh: 其恭如是。

translations.literal: His respectfulness was like this.

sentences.zh: 吾聞聖人之後，雖不當世，必有達者。

translations.literal: I have heard that descendants of sages, though not contemporary, must have achievers.

sentences.zh: 今孔丘年少好禮，其達者歟？

translations.literal: Now Kong Qiu is young and fond of ritual, is he an achiever?

sentences.zh: 吾即沒，若必師之。」

translations.literal: If I die, you must take him as teacher.'

sentences.zh: 及釐子卒，懿子與魯人南宮敬叔往學禮焉。

translations.literal: When Xi Zi died, Yi Zi and Lu man Nan Gong Jing Shu went to study ritual with him.

sentences.zh: 是歲，季武子卒，平子代立。

translations.literal: This year, Ji Wu Zi died, and Ping Zi succeeded him.

At age seventeen, Lu minister Meng Xi Zi was ill and near death, admonishing his heir Yi Zi saying: 'Kong Qiu is a descendant of sages, extinguished in Song. His ancestor Fu Fu He first had Song but yielded to Li Gong. And Zheng Kao Fu assisted Dai, Wu, and Xuan Gong, three summons becoming increasingly respectful, hence the ding inscription says: "One summons and bent, two summons and bowed, three summons and prostrated, following the wall and running, none dare insult me. Rice here, gruel here, to fill my mouth."' His respectfulness was like this. I have heard that descendants of sages, though not contemporary, must have achievers. Now Kong Qiu is young and fond of ritual, is he an achiever? If I die, you must take him as teacher.' When Xi Zi died, Yi Zi and Lu man Nan Gong Jing Shu went to study ritual with him. This year, Ji Wu Zi died, and Ping Zi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 孔子貧且賤。

translations.literal: Confucius was poor and lowly.

sentences.zh: 及長，嘗為季氏史，料量平；

translations.literal: When grown, he once served as Ji family accountant, measuring quantities fairly;

sentences.zh: 嘗為司職吏而畜蕃息。

translations.literal: once served as keeper of stores and increased the livestock.

sentences.zh: 由是為司空。

translations.literal: From this he became Director of Works.

sentences.zh: 已而去魯，斥乎齊，逐乎宋、衛，困於陳蔡之間，於是反魯。

translations.literal: Then he left Lu, was rejected in Qi, driven out of Song and Wei, besieged between Chen and Cai, then returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 孔子長九尺有六寸，人皆謂之「長人」而異之。

translations.literal: Confucius was nine chi six cun tall, people all called him 'tall man' and considered him unusual.

sentences.zh: 魯復善待，由是反魯。

translations.literal: Lu again treated him well, so he returned to Lu.

Confucius was poor and lowly. When grown, he once served as Ji family accountant, measuring quantities fairly; once served as keeper of stores and increased the livestock. From this he became Director of Works. Then he left Lu, was rejected in Qi, driven out of Song and Wei, besieged between Chen and Cai, then returned to Lu. Confucius was nine chi six cun tall, people all called him 'tall man' and considered him unusual. Lu again treated him well, so he returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯南宮敬叔言魯君曰：「請與孔子適周。」

translations.literal: Lu's Nan Gong Jing Shu spoke to the Lu lord saying: 'Please go with Confucius to Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 魯君與之一乘車，兩馬，一豎子俱，適周問禮，蓋見老子云。

translations.literal: The Lu lord gave him one chariot, two horses, one attendant, went to Zhou to inquire about ritual, reportedly meeting Lao Zi.

sentences.zh: 辭去，而老子送之曰：「吾聞富貴者送人以財，仁人者送人以言。

translations.literal: When leaving, Lao Zi saw him off saying: 'I have heard that the wealthy and noble send people off with wealth, benevolent people send people off with words.

sentences.zh: 吾不能富貴，竊仁人之號，送子以言，曰：『聰明深察而近於死者，好議人者也。

translations.literal: I cannot be wealthy and noble, I secretly bear the title of benevolent person, send you off with words, saying: "Those who are clever and deeply perceptive yet close to death are those who like to criticize others.

sentences.zh: 博辯廣大危其身者，發人之惡者也。

translations.literal: Those who are broadly argumentative and expansive endanger themselves are those who expose others' faults.

sentences.zh: 為人子者毋以有己，為人臣者毋以有己。』」

translations.literal: As a son, do not consider yourself important; as a minister, do not consider yourself important."'

sentences.zh: 孔子自周反于魯，弟子稍益進焉。

translations.literal: Confucius returned from Zhou to Lu, and disciples gradually increased.

Lu's Nan Gong Jing Shu spoke to the Lu lord saying: 'Please go with Confucius to Zhou.' The Lu lord gave him one chariot, two horses, one attendant, went to Zhou to inquire about ritual, reportedly meeting Lao Zi. When leaving, Lao Zi saw him off saying: 'I have heard that the wealthy and noble send people off with wealth, benevolent people send people off with words. I cannot be wealthy and noble, I secretly bear the title of benevolent person, send you off with words, saying: "Those who are clever and deeply perceptive yet close to death are those who like to criticize others. Those who are broadly argumentative and expansive endanger themselves are those who expose others' faults. As a son, do not consider yourself important; as a minister, do not consider yourself important."' Confucius returned from Zhou to Lu, and disciples gradually increased.

sentences.zh: 是時也，晉平公淫，六卿擅權，東伐諸侯；

translations.literal: At this time, Jin Ping Gong was licentious, the six ministers monopolized power, attacking eastern feudal lords;

sentences.zh: 楚靈王兵彊，陵轢中國；

translations.literal: Chu Ling Wang's troops were strong, trampling the central states;

sentences.zh: 齊大而近於魯。

translations.literal: Qi was large and close to Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯小弱，附於楚則晉怒；

translations.literal: Lu was small and weak, attaching to Chu angered Jin;

sentences.zh: 附於晉則楚來伐；

translations.literal: attaching to Jin brought Chu to attack;

sentences.zh: 不備於齊，齊師侵魯。

translations.literal: not preparing for Qi brought Qi troops to invade Lu.

At this time, Jin Ping Gong was licentious, the six ministers monopolized power, attacking eastern feudal lords; Chu Ling Wang's troops were strong, trampling the central states; Qi was large and close to Lu. Lu was small and weak, attaching to Chu angered Jin; attaching to Jin brought Chu to attack; not preparing for Qi brought Qi troops to invade Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯昭公之二十年，而孔子蓋年三十矣。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhao of Lu's twentieth year, Confucius was about thirty years old.

sentences.zh: 齊景公與晏嬰來適魯，景公問孔子曰：「昔秦穆公國小處辟，其霸何也？」

translations.literal: Qi Jing Gong and Yan Ying came to Lu, Jing Gong asked Confucius: 'In the past, Qin Mu Gong's state was small and in a remote place, how did he become hegemon?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「秦，國雖小，其志大；

translations.literal: He replied: 'Qin, though the state was small, its ambitions were great;

sentences.zh: 處雖辟，行中正。

translations.literal: though the place was remote, its conduct was upright.

sentences.zh: 身舉五羖，爵之大夫，起纍紲之中，與語三日，授之以政。

translations.literal: He personally selected the five black sheep, ennobled him as a minister, raised him from prison chains, spoke with him for three days, and entrusted him with governance.

sentences.zh: 以此取之，雖王可也，其霸小矣。」

translations.literal: With this he attained it, though becoming king was possible, his hegemony was but small.'

sentences.zh: 景公說。

translations.literal: Duke Jing was pleased.

In Duke Zhao of Lu's twentieth year, Confucius was about thirty years old. Qi Jing Gong and Yan Ying came to Lu, Jing Gong asked Confucius: 'In the past, Qin Mu Gong's state was small and in a remote place, how did he become hegemon?' He replied: 'Qin, though the state was small, its ambitions were great; though the place was remote, its conduct was upright. He personally selected the five black sheep, ennobled him as a minister, raised him from prison chains, spoke with him for three days, and entrusted him with governance. With this he attained it, though becoming king was possible, his hegemony was but small.' Duke Jing was pleased.

sentences.zh: 孔子年三十五，而季平子與郈昭伯以鬬雞故得罪魯昭公，昭公率師擊平子，平子與孟氏、叔孫氏三家共攻昭公，昭公師敗，奔於齊，齊處昭公乾侯。

translations.literal: Confucius was thirty-five when Ji Ping Zi and Hou Zhao Bo offended Duke Zhao of Lu over a cockfight, Duke Zhao led troops to attack Ping Zi, Ping Zi together with the Meng and Shusun families attacked Duke Zhao, Duke Zhao's troops were defeated, he fled to Qi, Qi settled him at Qianhou.

sentences.zh: 其後頃之，魯亂。

translations.literal: After a short while, Lu was in chaos.

sentences.zh: 孔子適齊，為高昭子家臣，欲以通乎景公。

translations.literal: Confucius went to Qi, became a minister in Gao Zhao Zi's household, wishing to gain access to Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 與齊太師語樂，聞韶音，學之，三月不知肉味，齊人稱之。

translations.literal: He discussed music with the Qi Grand Master, heard the Shao music, studied it, for three months did not know the taste of meat, the Qi people praised him.

Confucius was thirty-five when Ji Ping Zi and Hou Zhao Bo offended Duke Zhao of Lu over a cockfight, Duke Zhao led troops to attack Ping Zi, Ping Zi together with the Meng and Shusun families attacked Duke Zhao, Duke Zhao's troops were defeated, he fled to Qi, Qi settled him at Qianhou. After a short while, Lu was in chaos. Confucius went to Qi, became a minister in Gao Zhao Zi's household, wishing to gain access to Duke Jing. He discussed music with the Qi Grand Master, heard the Shao music, studied it, for three months did not know the taste of meat, the Qi people praised him.

sentences.zh: 景公問政孔子，孔子曰：「君君，臣臣，父父，子子。」

translations.literal: Duke Jing asked Confucius about governance, Confucius said: 'The lord acts as lord, the minister as minister, the father as father, the son as son.'

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「善哉！

translations.literal: Duke Jing said: 'Excellent!

sentences.zh: 信如君不君，臣不臣，父不父，子不子，雖有粟，吾豈得而食諸！」

translations.literal: If indeed the lord is not lord, minister not minister, father not father, son not son, though there is grain, how could I eat it!'

sentences.zh: 他日又復問政於孔子，孔子曰：「政在節財。」

translations.literal: Another day he again asked Confucius about governance, Confucius said: 'Governance lies in economizing expenditures.'

sentences.zh: 景公說，將欲以尼谿田封孔子。

translations.literal: Duke Jing was pleased, wished to enfeoff Confucius with Nixi fields.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰進曰：「夫儒者滑稽而不可軌法；

translations.literal: Yan Ying advanced saying: 'Scholars are glib and cannot be made into laws;

sentences.zh: 倨傲自順，不可以為下；

translations.literal: arrogant and self-satisfied, they cannot serve as subordinates;

sentences.zh: 崇喪遂哀，破產厚葬，不可以為俗；

translations.literal: they honor mourning and pursue grief, ruin their families with lavish burials, they cannot serve as customs;

sentences.zh: 游說乞貸，不可以為國。

translations.literal: wandering about persuading and begging, they cannot serve the state.

sentences.zh: 自大賢之息，周室既衰，禮樂缺有間。

translations.literal: From the descendants of great sages, the Zhou house has declined, rituals and music have lapsed for a time.

sentences.zh: 今孔子盛容飾，繁登降之禮，趨詳之節，累世不能殫其學，當年不能究其禮。

translations.literal: Now Confucius abundantly displays his appearance, multiplies the rituals of ascending and descending, makes detailed the steps of advancing and withdrawing, generations cannot exhaust his learning, in a year cannot complete his rituals.

sentences.zh: 君欲用之以移齊俗，非所以先細民也。」

translations.literal: Your lordship wishes to employ him to change Qi customs, this is not how to give precedence to the common people.'

sentences.zh: 後景公敬見孔子，不問其禮。

translations.literal: After this Duke Jing respectfully received Confucius, but did not question him about ritual.

sentences.zh: 異日，景公止孔子曰：「奉子以季氏，吾不能。」

translations.literal: Another day, Duke Jing stopped Confucius saying: 'I cannot present you to the Ji family.'

sentences.zh: 以季孟之間待之。

translations.literal: He treated him between the Ji and Meng families.

sentences.zh: 齊大夫欲害孔子，孔子聞之。

translations.literal: Qi ministers wished to harm Confucius, Confucius heard of it.

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「吾老矣，弗能用也。」

translations.literal: Duke Jing said: 'I am old, cannot employ him.'

sentences.zh: 孔子遂行，反乎魯。

translations.literal: Confucius thus departed, returned to Lu.

Duke Jing asked Confucius about governance, Confucius said: 'The lord acts as lord, the minister as minister, the father as father, the son as son.' Duke Jing said: 'Excellent! If indeed the lord is not lord, minister not minister, father not father, son not son, though there is grain, how could I eat it!' Another day he again asked Confucius about governance, Confucius said: 'Governance lies in economizing expenditures.' Duke Jing was pleased, wished to enfeoff Confucius with Nixi fields. Yan Ying advanced saying: 'Scholars are glib and cannot be made into laws; arrogant and self-satisfied, they cannot serve as subordinates; they honor mourning and pursue grief, ruin their families with lavish burials, they cannot serve as customs; wandering about persuading and begging, they cannot serve the state. From the descendants of great sages, the Zhou house has declined, rituals and music have lapsed for a time. Now Confucius abundantly displays his appearance, multiplies the rituals of ascending and descending, makes detailed the steps of advancing and withdrawing, generations cannot exhaust his learning, in a year cannot complete his rituals. Your lordship wishes to employ him to change Qi customs, this is not how to give precedence to the common people.' After this Duke Jing respectfully received Confucius, but did not question him about ritual. Another day, Duke Jing stopped Confucius saying: 'I cannot present you to the Ji family.' He treated him between the Ji and Meng families. Qi ministers wished to harm Confucius, Confucius heard of it. Duke Jing said: 'I am old, cannot employ him.' Confucius thus departed, returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 孔子年四十二，魯昭公卒於乾侯，定公立。

translations.literal: Confucius was forty-two, Duke Zhao of Lu died at Qianhou, Duke Ding succeeded.

sentences.zh: 定公立五年，夏，季平子卒，桓子嗣立。

translations.literal: Duke Ding succeeded for five years, summer, Ji Ping Zi died, Huan Zi succeeded.

sentences.zh: 季桓子穿井得土缶，中若羊，問仲尼云「得狗」。

translations.literal: Ji Huan Zi dug a well and obtained an earthen jar, inside resembled a sheep, asked Confucius saying 'got a dog'.

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「以丘所聞，羊也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'From what Qiu has heard, a sheep.

sentences.zh: 丘聞之，木石之怪夔、罔閬，水之怪龍、罔象，土之怪墳羊。」

translations.literal: Qiu has heard that wood and stone monsters are Kui and Wang Liang, water monsters are dragons and Wang Xiang, earth monsters are burial sheep.'

Confucius was forty-two, Duke Zhao of Lu died at Qianhou, Duke Ding succeeded. Duke Ding succeeded for five years, summer, Ji Ping Zi died, Huan Zi succeeded. Ji Huan Zi dug a well and obtained an earthen jar, inside resembled a sheep, asked Confucius saying 'got a dog'. Confucius said: 'From what Qiu has heard, a sheep. Qiu has heard that wood and stone monsters are Kui and Wang Liang, water monsters are dragons and Wang Xiang, earth monsters are burial sheep.'

sentences.zh: 吳伐越，墮會稽，得骨節專車。

translations.literal: Wu attacked Yue, destroyed Kuaiji, obtained bone joints filling a cart.

sentences.zh: 吳使使問仲尼：「骨何者最大？」

translations.literal: Wu sent an envoy to ask Confucius: 'Which bone is the largest?'

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「禹致群神於會稽山，防風氏後至，禹殺而戮之，其節專車，此為大矣。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Yu assembled the gods at Kuaiji Mountain, Fangfeng Shi arrived late, Yu killed and exposed him, his joints fill a cart, this is the largest.'

sentences.zh: 吳客曰：「誰為神？」

translations.literal: The Wu guest said: 'Who are the gods?'

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「山川之神足以綱紀天下，其守為神，社稷為公侯，皆屬於王者。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Mountain and river gods are sufficient to regulate All Under Heaven, their guardians are gods, altars of soil and grain are dukes and marquises, all belong to the Son of Heaven.'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「防風何守？」

translations.literal: The guest said: 'What does Fangfeng guard?'

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「汪罔氏之君守封、禺之山，為釐姓。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'The lord of Wang Mang clan guards Mount Feng and Mount Yu, is of Xi surname.

sentences.zh: 在虞、夏、商為汪罔，於周為長翟，今謂之大人。」

translations.literal: In Yu and Xia and Shang he was Wang Mang, in Zhou he is Chang Di, now called the great man.'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「人長幾何？」

translations.literal: The guest said: 'How tall are people?'

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「僬僥氏三尺，短之至也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'The Jiao Yao clan are three chi, the shortest to the utmost.

sentences.zh: 長者不過十之，數之極也。」

translations.literal: The tallest do not exceed ten times that, the limit of numbers.'

sentences.zh: 於是吳客曰：「善哉聖人！」

translations.literal: Thus the Wu guest said: 'Excellent, sage!'

Wu attacked Yue, destroyed Kuaiji, obtained bone joints filling a cart. Wu sent an envoy to ask Confucius: 'Which bone is the largest?' Confucius said: 'Yu assembled the gods at Kuaiji Mountain, Fangfeng Shi arrived late, Yu killed and exposed him, his joints fill a cart, this is the largest.' The Wu guest said: 'Who are the gods?' Confucius said: 'Mountain and river gods are sufficient to regulate All Under Heaven, their guardians are gods, altars of soil and grain are dukes and marquises, all belong to the Son of Heaven.' The guest said: 'What does Fangfeng guard?' Confucius said: 'The lord of Wang Mang clan guards Mount Feng and Mount Yu, is of Xi surname. In Yu and Xia and Shang he was Wang Mang, in Zhou he is Chang Di, now called the great man.' The guest said: 'How tall are people?' Confucius said: 'The Jiao Yao clan are three chi, the shortest to the utmost. The tallest do not exceed ten times that, the limit of numbers.' Thus the Wu guest said: 'Excellent, sage!'

sentences.zh: 桓子嬖臣曰仲梁懷，與陽虎有隙。

translations.literal: Huan Zi's favorite minister was Zhong Liang Huai, who was at odds with Yang Hu.

sentences.zh: 陽虎欲逐懷，公山不狃止之。

translations.literal: Yang Hu wished to expel Huai, Gong Shan Bu Niu stopped him.

sentences.zh: 其秋，懷益驕，陽虎執懷。

translations.literal: That autumn, Huai became even more arrogant, Yang Hu seized Huai.

sentences.zh: 桓子怒，陽虎因囚桓子，與盟而醳之。

translations.literal: Huan Zi was angry, Yang Hu thus imprisoned Huan Zi, made covenant and released him.

sentences.zh: 陽虎由此益輕季氏。

translations.literal: Yang Hu from this even more disrespected the Ji family.

sentences.zh: 季氏亦僭於公室，陪臣執國政，是以魯自大夫以下皆僭離於正道。

translations.literal: The Ji family also usurped from the ducal house, retainers grasped state power, thus Lu from the great officers down all usurped and departed from the proper way.

sentences.zh: 故孔子不仕，退而脩詩書禮樂，弟子彌眾，至自遠方，莫不受業焉。

translations.literal: Therefore Confucius did not serve, retired and studied poetry, documents, rituals, and music, disciples increasingly many, coming from distant places, all received instruction.

Huan Zi's favorite minister was Zhong Liang Huai, who was at odds with Yang Hu. Yang Hu wished to expel Huai, Gong Shan Bu Niu stopped him. That autumn, Huai became even more arrogant, Yang Hu seized Huai. Huan Zi was angry, Yang Hu thus imprisoned Huan Zi, made covenant and released him. Yang Hu from this even more disrespected the Ji family. The Ji family also usurped from the ducal house, retainers grasped state power, thus Lu from the great officers down all usurped and departed from the proper way. Therefore Confucius did not serve, retired and studied poetry, documents, rituals, and music, disciples increasingly many, coming from distant places, all received instruction.

sentences.zh: 定公八年，公山不狃不得意於季氏，因陽虎為亂，欲廢三桓之適，更立其庶孽陽虎素所善者，遂執季桓子。

translations.literal: In Duke Ding's eighth year, Gong Shan Bu Niu was dissatisfied with the Ji family, because of Yang Hu's rebellion, wished to abolish the legitimate heirs of the three Huans, establish Yang Hu's favorites among the concubines, thus seized Ji Huan Zi.

sentences.zh: 桓子詐之，得脫。

translations.literal: Huan Zi deceived him, obtained release.

sentences.zh: 定公九年，陽虎不勝，奔于齊。

translations.literal: In Duke Ding's ninth year, Yang Hu was defeated, fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 是時孔子年五十。

translations.literal: At this time Confucius was fifty years old.

In Duke Ding's eighth year, Gong Shan Bu Niu was dissatisfied with the Ji family, because of Yang Hu's rebellion, wished to abolish the legitimate heirs of the three Huans, establish Yang Hu's favorites among the concubines, thus seized Ji Huan Zi. Huan Zi deceived him, obtained release. In Duke Ding's ninth year, Yang Hu was defeated, fled to Qi. At this time Confucius was fifty years old.

sentences.zh: 公山不狃以費畔季氏，使人召孔子。

translations.literal: Gong Shan Bu Niu rebelled against the Ji family with Bi, sent someone to summon Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子循道彌久，溫溫無所試，莫能己用，曰：「蓋周文武起豐鎬而王，今費雖小，儻庶幾乎！」

translations.literal: Confucius had followed the Way for a long time, gently without being tested, none could employ him, said: 'Perhaps Zhou Wen and Wu arose from Feng and Hao to become kings, now Bi though small, perhaps I can manage it!'

sentences.zh: 欲往。

translations.literal: He wished to go.

sentences.zh: 子路不說，止孔子。

translations.literal: Zi Lu was displeased, stopped Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「夫召我者豈徒哉？

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Those who summon me, is it for nothing?

sentences.zh: 如用我，其為東周乎！」

translations.literal: If they employ me, it will be an Eastern Zhou!'

sentences.zh: 然亦卒不行。

translations.literal: Yet in the end he did not go.

Gong Shan Bu Niu rebelled against the Ji family with Bi, sent someone to summon Confucius. Confucius had followed the Way for a long time, gently without being tested, none could employ him, said: 'Perhaps Zhou Wen and Wu arose from Feng and Hao to become kings, now Bi though small, perhaps I can manage it!' He wished to go. Zi Lu was displeased, stopped Confucius. Confucius said: 'Those who summon me, is it for nothing? If they employ me, it will be an Eastern Zhou!' Yet in the end he did not go.

sentences.zh: 其後定公以孔子為中都宰，一年，四方皆則之。

translations.literal: After this Duke Ding appointed Confucius as Zhongdu magistrate, in one year the four directions all emulated him.

sentences.zh: 由中都宰為司空，由司空為大司寇。

translations.literal: From Zhongdu magistrate he became Director of Works, from Director of Works became Grand Minister of Justice.

After this Duke Ding appointed Confucius as Zhongdu magistrate, in one year the four directions all emulated him. From Zhongdu magistrate he became Director of Works, from Director of Works became Grand Minister of Justice.

sentences.zh: 定公十年春，及齊平。

translations.literal: In Duke Ding's tenth year spring, made peace with Qi.

sentences.zh: 夏，齊大夫黎鉏言於景公曰：「魯用孔丘，其勢危齊。」

translations.literal: Summer, Qi minister Li Chu spoke to Duke Jing saying: 'Lu employs Kong Qiu, this threatens Qi.'

sentences.zh: 乃使使告魯為好會，會於夾谷。

translations.literal: Thus sent an envoy to inform Lu of a friendly meeting, meeting at Jiagu.

sentences.zh: 魯定公且以乘車好往。

translations.literal: Duke Ding of Lu was about to go with a chariot in friendship.

sentences.zh: 孔子攝相事，曰：「臣聞有文事者必有武備，有武事者必有文備。

translations.literal: Confucius acted as prime minister, said: 'I have heard that those who have civil affairs must have military preparations, those who have military affairs must have civil preparations.

sentences.zh: 古者諸侯出疆，必具官以從。

translations.literal: In ancient times when feudal lords left their territory, they must have complete officials accompany them.

sentences.zh: 請具左右司馬。」

translations.literal: Please prepare left and right marshals.'

sentences.zh: 定公曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Duke Ding said: 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 具左右司馬。

translations.literal: Prepared left and right marshals.

sentences.zh: 會齊侯夾谷，為壇位，土階三等，以會遇之禮相見，揖讓而登。

translations.literal: Met the Qi duke at Jiagu, established altar positions, earthen steps three levels, met with meeting etiquette, bowed and yielded and ascended.

sentences.zh: 獻酬之禮畢，齊有司趨而進曰：「請奏四方之樂。」

translations.literal: The offering and toasting rituals completed, Qi officials hurried forward saying: 'Please perform the music of the four directions.'

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Duke Jing said: 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 於是旍旄羽袚矛戟劍撥鼓噪而至。

translations.literal: Thus banners, yak tails, feathers, halberds, spears, swords, shields, drums, and shouting arrived.

sentences.zh: 孔子趨而進，歷階而登，不盡一等，舉袂而言曰：「吾兩君為好會，夷狄之樂何為於此！

translations.literal: Confucius hurried forward, ascended the steps without completing one level, raised his sleeve and spoke: 'Our two lords make a friendly meeting, why is barbarian music here!

sentences.zh: 請命有司！」

translations.literal: Please command the officials!'

sentences.zh: 有司卻之，不去，則左右視晏子與景公。

translations.literal: The officials repelled them, they did not leave, then looked left and right at Yan Ying and Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 景公心怍，麾而去之。

translations.literal: Duke Jing was ashamed in heart, waved them away.

sentences.zh: 有頃，齊有司趨而進曰：「請奏宮中之樂。」

translations.literal: After a while, Qi officials hurried forward saying: 'Please perform inner palace music.'

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Duke Jing said: 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 優倡侏儒為戲而前。

translations.literal: Actors and dwarfs performed plays and advanced.

sentences.zh: 孔子趨而進，歷階而登，不盡一等，曰：「匹夫而營惑諸侯者罪當誅！

translations.literal: Confucius hurried forward, ascended the steps without completing one level, said: 'Common fellows who deceive feudal lords, their crime deserves execution!

sentences.zh: 請命有司！」

translations.literal: Please command the officials!'

sentences.zh: 有司加法焉，手足異處。

translations.literal: The officials applied the law, hands and feet separated.

sentences.zh: 景公懼而動，知義不若，歸而大恐，告其群臣曰：「魯以君子之道輔其君，而子獨以夷狄之道教寡人，使得罪於魯君，為之奈何？」

translations.literal: Duke Jing was fearful and moved, knew righteousness was inferior, returned and greatly feared, told his ministers: 'Lu assists its lord with the way of gentlemen, but you alone teach me the way of barbarians, causing me to offend the Lu lord, what can be done?'

sentences.zh: 有司進對曰：「君子有過則謝以質，小人有過則謝以文。

translations.literal: The officials advanced replying: 'Gentlemen apologize for mistakes with sincerity, petty men apologize for mistakes with words.

sentences.zh: 君若悼之，則謝以質。」

translations.literal: If your lordship regrets it, then apologize with sincerity.'

sentences.zh: 於是齊侯乃歸所侵魯之鄆、汶陽、龜陰之田以謝過。

translations.literal: Thus the Qi duke returned the invaded Lu territories of Yun, Wen Yang, and Gui Yin to apologize for the offense.

In Duke Ding's tenth year spring, made peace with Qi. Summer, Qi minister Li Chu spoke to Duke Jing saying: 'Lu employs Kong Qiu, this threatens Qi.' Thus sent an envoy to inform Lu of a friendly meeting, meeting at Jiagu. Duke Ding of Lu was about to go with a chariot in friendship. Confucius acted as prime minister, said: 'I have heard that those who have civil affairs must have military preparations, those who have military affairs must have civil preparations. In ancient times when feudal lords left their territory, they must have complete officials accompany them. Please prepare left and right marshals.' Duke Ding said: 'Very well.' Prepared left and right marshals. Met the Qi duke at Jiagu, established altar positions, earthen steps three levels, met with meeting etiquette, bowed and yielded and ascended. The offering and toasting rituals completed, Qi officials hurried forward saying: 'Please perform the music of the four directions.' Duke Jing said: 'Very well.' Thus banners, yak tails, feathers, halberds, spears, swords, shields, drums, and shouting arrived. Confucius hurried forward, ascended the steps without completing one level, raised his sleeve and spoke: 'Our two lords make a friendly meeting, why is barbarian music here! Please command the officials!' The officials repelled them, they did not leave, then looked left and right at Yan Ying and Duke Jing. Duke Jing was ashamed in heart, waved them away. After a while, Qi officials hurried forward saying: 'Please perform inner palace music.' Duke Jing said: 'Very well.' Actors and dwarfs performed plays and advanced. Confucius hurried forward, ascended the steps without completing one level, said: 'Common fellows who deceive feudal lords, their crime deserves execution! Please command the officials!' The officials applied the law, hands and feet separated. Duke Jing was fearful and moved, knew righteousness was inferior, returned and greatly feared, told his ministers: 'Lu assists its lord with the way of gentlemen, but you alone teach me the way of barbarians, causing me to offend the Lu lord, what can be done?' The officials advanced replying: 'Gentlemen apologize for mistakes with sincerity, petty men apologize for mistakes with words. If your lordship regrets it, then apologize with sincerity.' Thus the Qi duke returned the invaded Lu territories of Yun, Wen Yang, and Gui Yin to apologize for the offense.

sentences.zh: 定公十三年夏，孔子言於定公曰：「臣無藏甲，大夫毋百雉之城。」

translations.literal: In Duke Ding's thirteenth year summer, Confucius spoke to Duke Ding: 'Ministers should not store armor, great officers should not have cities of one hundred mou.'

sentences.zh: 使仲由為季氏宰，將墮三都。

translations.literal: Had Zhong You serve as Ji family magistrate, about to destroy the three cities.

sentences.zh: 於是叔孫氏先墮郈。

translations.literal: Thus the Shusun family first destroyed Hou.

sentences.zh: 季氏將墮費，公山不狃、叔孫輒率費人襲魯。

translations.literal: The Ji family was about to destroy Bi, Gong Shan Bu Niu and Shusun Zhe led the Bi people to attack Lu.

sentences.zh: 公與三子入于季氏之宮，登武子之臺。

translations.literal: The duke and the three families entered the Ji family palace, ascended Wu Zi's terrace.

sentences.zh: 費人攻之，弗克，入及公側。

translations.literal: The Bi people attacked them, could not conquer, entered and reached the duke's side.

sentences.zh: 孔子命申句須、樂頎下伐之，費人北。

translations.literal: Confucius ordered Shen Ju Xu and Yue Yi to descend and attack them, the Bi people fled north.

sentences.zh: 國人追之，敗諸姑蔑。

translations.literal: The state people pursued them, defeated them at Gu Mie.

sentences.zh: 二子奔齊，遂墮費。

translations.literal: The two men fled to Qi, thus destroyed Bi.

sentences.zh: 將墮成，公斂處父謂孟孫曰：「墮成，齊人必至于北門。

translations.literal: About to destroy Cheng, Duke Lian Chu Fu told Meng Sun: 'Destroying Cheng, the Qi people will certainly reach the north gate.

sentences.zh: 且成，孟氏之保鄣，無成是無孟氏也。

translations.literal: Moreover Cheng is the Meng family's protective barrier, without Cheng there is no Meng family.

sentences.zh: 我將弗墮。」

translations.literal: I will not destroy it.'

sentences.zh: 十二月，公圍成，弗克。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, the duke besieged Cheng but could not conquer it.

In Duke Ding's thirteenth year summer, Confucius spoke to Duke Ding: 'Ministers should not store armor, great officers should not have cities of one hundred mou.' Had Zhong You serve as Ji family magistrate, about to destroy the three cities. Thus the Shusun family first destroyed Hou. The Ji family was about to destroy Bi, Gong Shan Bu Niu and Shusun Zhe led the Bi people to attack Lu. The duke and the three families entered the Ji family palace, ascended Wu Zi's terrace. The Bi people attacked them, could not conquer, entered and reached the duke's side. Confucius ordered Shen Ju Xu and Yue Yi to descend and attack them, the Bi people fled north. The state people pursued them, defeated them at Gu Mie. The two men fled to Qi, thus destroyed Bi. About to destroy Cheng, Duke Lian Chu Fu told Meng Sun: 'Destroying Cheng, the Qi people will certainly reach the north gate. Moreover Cheng is the Meng family's protective barrier, without Cheng there is no Meng family. I will not destroy it.' Twelfth month, the duke besieged Cheng but could not conquer it.

sentences.zh: 定公十四年，孔子年五十六，由大司寇行攝相事，有喜色。

translations.literal: Duke Ding's fourteenth year, Confucius was fifty-six, from Grand Minister of Justice acted as prime minister, showing happy expression.

sentences.zh: 門人曰：「聞君子禍至不懼，福至不喜。」

translations.literal: Disciples said: 'We have heard that gentlemen do not fear when disaster comes, do not rejoice when fortune arrives.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「有是言也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'There are these words.

sentences.zh: 不曰『樂其以貴下人』乎？」

translations.literal: Does it not say "delight in using nobility to humble oneself"?'

sentences.zh: 於是誅魯大夫亂政者少正卯。

translations.literal: Thus he executed Lu minister who disturbed the government, Shao Zheng Mao.

sentences.zh: 與聞國政三月，粥羔豚者弗飾賈；

translations.literal: Participated in national affairs three months, those selling lambs and pigs did not inflate prices;

sentences.zh: 男女行者別於塗；

translations.literal: men and women walking kept to separate paths;

sentences.zh: 塗不拾遺；

translations.literal: nothing was picked up and kept from the roads;

sentences.zh: 四方之客至乎邑者不求有司，皆予之以歸。

translations.literal: travelers from the four directions arriving at towns did not seek officials, all given what they needed to return home.

Duke Ding's fourteenth year, Confucius was fifty-six, from Grand Minister of Justice acted as prime minister, showing happy expression. Disciples said: 'We have heard that gentlemen do not fear when disaster comes, do not rejoice when fortune arrives.' Confucius said: 'There are these words. Does it not say "delight in using nobility to humble oneself"?' Thus he executed Lu minister who disturbed the government, Shao Zheng Mao. Participated in national affairs three months, those selling lambs and pigs did not inflate prices; men and women walking kept to separate paths; nothing was picked up and kept from the roads; travelers from the four directions arriving at towns did not seek officials, all given what they needed to return home.

sentences.zh: 齊人聞而懼，曰：「孔子為政必霸，霸則吾地近焉，我之為先并矣。

translations.literal: Qi people heard and feared, said: 'If Confucius governs he will certainly become hegemon, if hegemon then our territory is close, we will be the first annexed.

sentences.zh: 盍致地焉？」

translations.literal: Why not offer territory?'

sentences.zh: 黎鉏曰：「請先嘗沮之；

translations.literal: Li Chu said: 'Please first try to obstruct him;

sentences.zh: 沮之而不可則致地，庸遲乎！」

translations.literal: if obstructing him proves impossible then offer territory, how late would that be!'

sentences.zh: 於是選齊國中女子好者八十人，皆衣文衣而舞康樂，文馬三十駟，遺魯君。

translations.literal: Thus selected eighty beautiful women from Qi, all clothed in embroidered garments dancing Kang Le, thirty teams of fine horses, sent to Lu lord.

sentences.zh: 陳女樂文馬於魯城南高門外，季桓子微服往觀再三，將受，乃語魯君為周道游，往觀終日，怠於政事。

translations.literal: Displayed female musicians and fine horses outside Lu city's south high gate, Ji Huan Zi in plain clothes went to view several times, about to accept, then told Lu lord to travel Zhou roads, went to view all day, neglected government affairs.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「夫子可以行矣。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Master can leave.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「魯今且郊，如致膰乎大夫，則吾猶可以止。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Lu now will perform the suburban sacrifice, if they offer the sacrificial meat to ministers, then I can still remain.'

sentences.zh: 桓子卒受齊女樂，三日不聽政；

translations.literal: Huan Zi finally accepted Qi's female musicians, three days did not attend to government;

sentences.zh: 郊，又不致膰俎於大夫。

translations.literal: at the suburban sacrifice, also did not offer sacrificial meats to ministers.

sentences.zh: 孔子遂行，宿乎屯。

translations.literal: Confucius thus left, lodged at Tun.

sentences.zh: 而師己送，曰：「夫子則非罪。」

translations.literal: Shi Yi sent him off, said: 'Master is not at fault.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「吾歌可夫？」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'May I sing?'

sentences.zh: 歌曰：「彼婦之口，可以出走；

translations.literal: Sang: 'That woman's mouth can make one flee;

sentences.zh: 彼婦之謁，可以死敗。

translations.literal: that woman's flattery can lead to death and defeat.

sentences.zh: 蓋優哉游哉，維以卒歲！」

translations.literal: Alas, wandering wandering, just to end the year!'

sentences.zh: 師己反，桓子曰：「孔子亦何言？」

translations.literal: Shi Yi returned, Huan Zi said: 'What did Confucius say?'

sentences.zh: 師己以實告。

translations.literal: Shi Yi truthfully told him.

sentences.zh: 桓子喟然嘆曰：「夫子罪我以群婢故也夫！」

translations.literal: Huan Zi sighed deeply: 'Master blames me because of the female slaves!'

Qi people heard and feared, said: 'If Confucius governs he will certainly become hegemon, if hegemon then our territory is close, we will be the first annexed. Why not offer territory?' Li Chu said: 'Please first try to obstruct him; if obstructing him proves impossible then offer territory, how late would that be!' Thus selected eighty beautiful women from Qi, all clothed in embroidered garments dancing Kang Le, thirty teams of fine horses, sent to Lu lord. Displayed female musicians and fine horses outside Lu city's south high gate, Ji Huan Zi in plain clothes went to view several times, about to accept, then told Lu lord to travel Zhou roads, went to view all day, neglected government affairs. Zi Lu said: 'Master can leave.' Confucius said: 'Lu now will perform the suburban sacrifice, if they offer the sacrificial meat to ministers, then I can still remain.' Huan Zi finally accepted Qi's female musicians, three days did not attend to government; at the suburban sacrifice, also did not offer sacrificial meats to ministers. Confucius thus left, lodged at Tun. Shi Yi sent him off, said: 'Master is not at fault.' Confucius said: 'May I sing?' Sang: 'That woman's mouth can make one flee; that woman's flattery can lead to death and defeat. Alas, wandering wandering, just to end the year!' Shi Yi returned, Huan Zi said: 'What did Confucius say?' Shi Yi truthfully told him. Huan Zi sighed deeply: 'Master blames me because of the female slaves!'

sentences.zh: 孔子遂適衛，主於子路妻兄顏濁鄒家。

translations.literal: Confucius thus went to Wei, stayed at Zi Lu's wife's brother Yan Zhu Zou's home.

sentences.zh: 衛靈公問孔子：「居魯得祿幾何？」

translations.literal: Wei Ling Gong asked Confucius: 'When living in Lu, how much salary did you receive?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「奉粟六萬。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Six hundred thousand bushels of grain.'

sentences.zh: 衛人亦致粟六萬。

translations.literal: Wei people also gave six hundred thousand bushels.

sentences.zh: 居頃之，或譖孔子於衛靈公。

translations.literal: After staying a while, someone slandered Confucius to Wei Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 靈公使公孫余假一出一入。

translations.literal: Ling Gong made Gong Sun Yu monitor his comings and goings.

sentences.zh: 孔子恐獲罪焉，居十月，去衛。

translations.literal: Confucius feared being convicted, after ten months, left Wei.

Confucius thus went to Wei, stayed at Zi Lu's wife's brother Yan Zhu Zou's home. Wei Ling Gong asked Confucius: 'When living in Lu, how much salary did you receive?' Replied: 'Six hundred thousand bushels of grain.' Wei people also gave six hundred thousand bushels. After staying a while, someone slandered Confucius to Wei Ling Gong. Ling Gong made Gong Sun Yu monitor his comings and goings. Confucius feared being convicted, after ten months, left Wei.

sentences.zh: 將適陳，過匡，顏刻為僕，以其策指之曰：「昔吾入此，由彼缺也。」

translations.literal: About to go to Chen, passed through Kuang, Yan Ke as servant, pointed with his whip saying: 'Formerly I entered here, through that gap.'

sentences.zh: 匡人聞之，以為魯之陽虎。

translations.literal: Kuang people heard it, thought he was Lu's Yang Hu.

sentences.zh: 陽虎嘗暴匡人，匡人於是遂止孔子。

translations.literal: Yang Hu had once oppressed Kuang people, Kuang people thus stopped Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子狀類陽虎，拘焉五日，顏淵後，子曰：「吾以汝為死矣。」

translations.literal: Confucius's appearance resembled Yang Hu, imprisoned five days, Yan Yuan arrived later, Confucius said: 'I thought you had died.'

sentences.zh: 顏淵曰：「子在，回何敢死！」

translations.literal: Yan Yuan said: 'Master is here, how dare I die!'

sentences.zh: 匡人拘孔子益急，弟子懼。

translations.literal: Kuang people imprisoned Confucius even more urgently, disciples feared.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「文王既沒，文不在茲乎？

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Since King Wen has passed, is culture not here?

sentences.zh: 天之將喪斯文也，後死者不得與于斯文也。

translations.literal: If Heaven will lose this culture, later deaths cannot participate in this culture.

sentences.zh: 天之未喪斯文也，匡人其如予何！」

translations.literal: If Heaven has not lost this culture, what can Kuang people do to me!'

sentences.zh: 孔子使從者為甯武子臣於衛，然後得去。

translations.literal: Confucius made followers serve as Ning Wu Zi's ministers in Wei, then was able to leave.

About to go to Chen, passed through Kuang, Yan Ke as servant, pointed with his whip saying: 'Formerly I entered here, through that gap.' Kuang people heard it, thought he was Lu's Yang Hu. Yang Hu had once oppressed Kuang people, Kuang people thus stopped Confucius. Confucius's appearance resembled Yang Hu, imprisoned five days, Yan Yuan arrived later, Confucius said: 'I thought you had died.' Yan Yuan said: 'Master is here, how dare I die!' Kuang people imprisoned Confucius even more urgently, disciples feared. Confucius said: 'Since King Wen has passed, is culture not here? If Heaven will lose this culture, later deaths cannot participate in this culture. If Heaven has not lost this culture, what can Kuang people do to me!' Confucius made followers serve as Ning Wu Zi's ministers in Wei, then was able to leave.

sentences.zh: 去即過蒲。

translations.literal: Left and passed through Pu.

sentences.zh: 月餘，反乎衛，主蘧伯玉家。

translations.literal: Over a month, returned to Wei, stayed at Qu Bo Yu's home.

sentences.zh: 靈公夫人有南子者，使人謂孔子曰：「四方之君子不辱欲與寡君為兄弟者，必見寡小君。

translations.literal: Wei Ling Gong's wife was named Nan Zi, she sent someone to tell Confucius: 'Gentlemen from the four directions who do not consider it humiliating to become brothers with my lord must see my little lord.

sentences.zh: 寡小君願見。」

translations.literal: My little lord wishes to see.'

sentences.zh: 孔子辭謝，不得已而見之。

translations.literal: Confucius declined politely, but had no choice and saw her.

sentences.zh: 夫人在絺帷中。

translations.literal: The wife was in thin curtains.

sentences.zh: 孔子入門，北面稽首。

translations.literal: Confucius entered the gate, faced north and bowed with hands to ground.

sentences.zh: 夫人自帷中再拜，環珮玉聲璆然。

translations.literal: The wife bowed twice from within the curtains, her jade pendants clinking.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「吾鄉為弗見，見之禮答焉。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'I wished not to see, having seen I respond with ritual.'

sentences.zh: 子路不說。

translations.literal: Zi Lu was displeased.

sentences.zh: 孔子矢之曰：「予所不者，天厭之！

translations.literal: Confucius swore saying: 'If I have done wrong, Heaven reject me!

sentences.zh: 天厭之！」

translations.literal: Heaven reject me!'

sentences.zh: 居衛月餘，靈公與夫人同車，宦者雍渠參乘，出，使孔子為次乘，招搖市過之。

translations.literal: After staying in Wei over a month, Ling Gong and his wife rode in the same chariot, eunuch Yong Qu was the passenger, went out, made Confucius the next chariot, swaggered through the market past him.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「吾未見好德如好色者也。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'I have never seen one who loves virtue like loving beauty.'

sentences.zh: 於是醜之，去衛，過曹。

translations.literal: Thus he despised it and left Wei, passing through Cao.

sentences.zh: 是歲，魯定公卒。

translations.literal: This year, Lu Ding Gong died.

Left and passed through Pu. Over a month, returned to Wei, stayed at Qu Bo Yu's home. Wei Ling Gong's wife was named Nan Zi, she sent someone to tell Confucius: 'Gentlemen from the four directions who do not consider it humiliating to become brothers with my lord must see my little lord. My little lord wishes to see.' Confucius declined politely, but had no choice and saw her. The wife was in thin curtains. Confucius entered the gate, faced north and bowed with hands to ground. The wife bowed twice from within the curtains, her jade pendants clinking. Confucius said: 'I wished not to see, having seen I respond with ritual.' Zi Lu was displeased. Confucius swore saying: 'If I have done wrong, Heaven reject me! Heaven reject me!' After staying in Wei over a month, Ling Gong and his wife rode in the same chariot, eunuch Yong Qu was the passenger, went out, made Confucius the next chariot, swaggered through the market past him. Confucius said: 'I have never seen one who loves virtue like loving beauty.' Thus he despised it and left Wei, passing through Cao. This year, Lu Ding Gong died.

sentences.zh: 孔子去曹適宋，與弟子習禮大樹下。

translations.literal: Confucius left Cao for Song, practicing ritual with disciples under a large tree.

sentences.zh: 宋司馬桓魋欲殺孔子，拔其樹。

translations.literal: Song commander Huan Tui wanted to kill Confucius, chopped down his tree.

sentences.zh: 孔子去。

translations.literal: Confucius left.

sentences.zh: 弟子曰：「可以速矣。」

translations.literal: Disciples said: 'We can hurry.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「天生德於予，桓魋其如予何！」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Heaven has endowed virtue in me, what can Huan Tui do to me!'

Confucius left Cao for Song, practicing ritual with disciples under a large tree. Song commander Huan Tui wanted to kill Confucius, chopped down his tree. Confucius left. Disciples said: 'We can hurry.' Confucius said: 'Heaven has endowed virtue in me, what can Huan Tui do to me!'

sentences.zh: 孔子適鄭，與弟子相失，孔子獨立郭東門。

translations.literal: Confucius went to Zheng, became separated from his disciples, Confucius stood alone at the eastern gate of the outer wall.

sentences.zh: 鄭人或謂子貢曰：「東門有人，其顙似堯，其項類皋陶，其肩類子產，然自要以下不及禹三寸。

translations.literal: A Zheng person told Zi Gong: 'There is a man at the eastern gate, his forehead resembles Yao, his neck resembles Gao Tao, his shoulders resemble Zi Chan, but from the waist down he is three cun shorter than Yu.

sentences.zh: 纍纍若喪家之狗。」

translations.literal: Wearily like a homeless dog.'

sentences.zh: 子貢以實告孔子。

translations.literal: Zi Gong truthfully told Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子欣然笑曰：「形狀，末也。

translations.literal: Confucius smiled happily and said: 'Appearance is superficial.

sentences.zh: 而謂似喪家之狗，然哉！

translations.literal: But to say resembling a homeless dog, yes indeed!

sentences.zh: 然哉！」

translations.literal: Yes indeed!'

Confucius went to Zheng, became separated from his disciples, Confucius stood alone at the eastern gate of the outer wall. A Zheng person told Zi Gong: 'There is a man at the eastern gate, his forehead resembles Yao, his neck resembles Gao Tao, his shoulders resemble Zi Chan, but from the waist down he is three cun shorter than Yu. Wearily like a homeless dog.' Zi Gong truthfully told Confucius. Confucius smiled happily and said: 'Appearance is superficial. But to say resembling a homeless dog, yes indeed! Yes indeed!'

sentences.zh: 孔子遂至陳，主於司城貞子家。

translations.literal: Confucius arrived at Chen, staying at the home of Director of Construction Zhen Zi.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，吳王夫差伐陳，取三邑而去。

translations.literal: Over a year, Wu King Fu Chai attacked Chen, took three cities and left.

sentences.zh: 趙鞅伐朝歌。

translations.literal: Zhao Yang attacked Zhaoge.

sentences.zh: 楚圍蔡，蔡遷于吳。

translations.literal: Chu besieged Cai, Cai moved to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳敗越王句踐會稽。

translations.literal: Wu defeated Yue King Gou Jian at Kuaiji.

Confucius arrived at Chen, staying at the home of Director of Construction Zhen Zi. Over a year, Wu King Fu Chai attacked Chen, took three cities and left. Zhao Yang attacked Zhaoge. Chu besieged Cai, Cai moved to Wu. Wu defeated Yue King Gou Jian at Kuaiji.

sentences.zh: 有隼集于陳廷而死，楛矢貫之，石砮，矢長尺有咫。

translations.literal: A falcon gathered in the Chen court and died, pierced by a hu arrow, stone point, the arrow a chi and eight cun long.

sentences.zh: 陳湣公使使問仲尼。

translations.literal: Chen Min Gong sent an envoy to ask Confucius.

sentences.zh: 仲尼曰：「隼來遠矣，此肅慎之矢也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'The falcon came from afar, this is a Su Shen arrow.

sentences.zh: 昔武王克商，通道九夷百蠻，使各以其方賄來貢，使無忘職業。

translations.literal: In the past when King Wu conquered Shang, he opened roads to the nine Yi and hundred Man, made each bring their local tribute to contribute, so they would not forget their duties.

sentences.zh: 於是肅慎貢楛矢石砮，長尺有咫。

translations.literal: Thus Su Shen contributed hu arrows and stone points, a chi and eight cun long.

sentences.zh: 先王欲昭其令德，以肅慎矢分大姬，配虞胡公而封諸陳。

translations.literal: The former kings wished to display their excellent virtue, divided the Su Shen arrows to give to Da Ji, matched with Yu Hu Gong and enfeoffed them at Chen.

sentences.zh: 分同姓以珍玉，展親；

translations.literal: Divided same surnames with precious jade to display closeness;

sentences.zh: 分異姓以遠職，使無忘服。

translations.literal: divided different surnames with distant duties so they would not forget submission.

sentences.zh: 故分陳以肅慎矢。」

translations.literal: Therefore divided Chen with Su Shen arrows.'

sentences.zh: 試求之故府，果得之。

translations.literal: They tried seeking in the old treasury, indeed found them.

A falcon gathered in the Chen court and died, pierced by a hu arrow, stone point, the arrow a chi and eight cun long. Chen Min Gong sent an envoy to ask Confucius. Confucius said: 'The falcon came from afar, this is a Su Shen arrow. In the past when King Wu conquered Shang, he opened roads to the nine Yi and hundred Man, made each bring their local tribute to contribute, so they would not forget their duties. Thus Su Shen contributed hu arrows and stone points, a chi and eight cun long. The former kings wished to display their excellent virtue, divided the Su Shen arrows to give to Da Ji, matched with Yu Hu Gong and enfeoffed them at Chen. Divided same surnames with precious jade to display closeness; divided different surnames with distant duties so they would not forget submission. Therefore divided Chen with Su Shen arrows.' They tried seeking in the old treasury, indeed found them.

sentences.zh: 孔子居陳三歲，會晉楚爭彊，更伐陳，及吳侵陳，陳常被寇。

translations.literal: Confucius stayed in Chen three years, when Jin and Chu contended for strength, alternately attacking Chen, and Wu invaded Chen, Chen was constantly raided.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「歸與！

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Return home!

sentences.zh: 歸與！

translations.literal: Return home!

sentences.zh: 吾黨之小子狂簡，進取不忘其初。」

translations.literal: My party's youths are simple and ardent, advancing and gaining without forgetting their beginnings.'

sentences.zh: 於是孔子去陳。

translations.literal: Thus Confucius left Chen.

Confucius stayed in Chen three years, when Jin and Chu contended for strength, alternately attacking Chen, and Wu invaded Chen, Chen was constantly raided. Confucius said: 'Return home! Return home! My party's youths are simple and ardent, advancing and gaining without forgetting their beginnings.' Thus Confucius left Chen.

sentences.zh: 過蒲，會公叔氏以蒲畔，蒲人止孔子。

translations.literal: Passing through Pu, encountered Gong Shu clan rebelling with Pu, Pu people stopped Confucius.

sentences.zh: 弟子有公良孺者，以私車五乘從孔子。

translations.literal: Among disciples was Gong Liang Ru, who followed Confucius with five private chariots.

sentences.zh: 其為人長賢，有勇力，謂曰：「吾昔從夫子遇難於匡，今又遇難於此，命也已。

translations.literal: His character was tall and worthy, with courage and strength, he said: 'I once followed master and encountered difficulty at Kuang, now encounter difficulty here again, it is fate.

sentences.zh: 吾與夫子再罹難，寧鬬而死。」

translations.literal: I and master have suffered difficulty twice, would rather fight and die.'

sentences.zh: 鬬甚疾。

translations.literal: He fought very fiercely.

sentences.zh: 蒲人懼，謂孔子曰：「苟毋適衛，吾出子。」

translations.literal: Pu people feared, told Confucius: 'If you do not go to Wei, we will release you.'

sentences.zh: 與之盟，出孔子東門。

translations.literal: Made covenant with them, released Confucius out the east gate.

sentences.zh: 孔子遂適衛。

translations.literal: Confucius thus went to Wei.

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「盟可負耶？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'Can covenants be broken?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「要盟也，神不聽。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'It was a forced covenant, the spirits do not accept it.'

Passing through Pu, encountered Gong Shu clan rebelling with Pu, Pu people stopped Confucius. Among disciples was Gong Liang Ru, who followed Confucius with five private chariots. His character was tall and worthy, with courage and strength, he said: 'I once followed master and encountered difficulty at Kuang, now encounter difficulty here again, it is fate. I and master have suffered difficulty twice, would rather fight and die.' He fought very fiercely. Pu people feared, told Confucius: 'If you do not go to Wei, we will release you.' Made covenant with them, released Confucius out the east gate. Confucius thus went to Wei. Zi Gong said: 'Can covenants be broken?' Confucius said: 'It was a forced covenant, the spirits do not accept it.'

sentences.zh: 衛靈公聞孔子來，喜，郊迎。

translations.literal: Wei Ling Gong heard Confucius was coming, was pleased, welcomed him at the suburbs.

sentences.zh: 問曰：「蒲可伐乎？」

translations.literal: Asked: 'Can Pu be attacked?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「可。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'It can.'

sentences.zh: 靈公曰：「吾大夫以為不可。

translations.literal: Ling Gong said: 'My ministers think it cannot.

sentences.zh: 今蒲，衛之所以待晉楚也，以衛伐之，無乃不可乎？」

translations.literal: Now Pu is what Wei uses to deal with Jin and Chu, to attack it with Wei, is it not impossible?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「其男子有死之志，婦人有保西河之志。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Its men have the will to die, its women have the will to defend the west river.

sentences.zh: 吾所伐者不過四五人。」

translations.literal: Those I would attack are no more than four or five people.'

sentences.zh: 靈公曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Ling Gong said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 然不伐蒲。

translations.literal: Yet did not attack Pu.

Wei Ling Gong heard Confucius was coming, was pleased, welcomed him at the suburbs. Asked: 'Can Pu be attacked?' Replied: 'It can.' Ling Gong said: 'My ministers think it cannot. Now Pu is what Wei uses to deal with Jin and Chu, to attack it with Wei, is it not impossible?' Confucius said: 'Its men have the will to die, its women have the will to defend the west river. Those I would attack are no more than four or five people.' Ling Gong said: 'Good.' Yet did not attack Pu.

sentences.zh: 靈公老，怠於政，不用孔子。

translations.literal: Ling Gong was old, neglected government affairs, did not employ Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子喟然歎曰：「苟有用我者，朞月而已，三年有成。」

translations.literal: Confucius sighed deeply: 'If someone would employ me, in one month there would be results, in three years achievement.'

sentences.zh: 孔子行。

translations.literal: Confucius departed.

Ling Gong was old, neglected government affairs, did not employ Confucius. Confucius sighed deeply: 'If someone would employ me, in one month there would be results, in three years achievement.' Confucius departed.

sentences.zh: 佛肸為中牟宰。

translations.literal: Fo Xi was magistrate of Zhongmu.

sentences.zh: 趙簡子攻范、中行，伐中牟。

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi attacked Fan and Zhong Xing, attacked Zhongmu.

sentences.zh: 佛肸畔，使人召孔子。

translations.literal: Fo Xi rebelled, sent someone to summon Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子欲往。

translations.literal: Confucius wished to go.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「由聞諸夫子，『其身親為不善者，君子不入也』。

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'I heard from the master, "Gentlemen do not enter where those who personally do evil are."

sentences.zh: 今佛肸親以中牟畔，子欲往，如之何？」

translations.literal: Now Fo Xi personally rebels with Zhongmu, master wishes to go, how is this?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「有是言也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'There are these words.

sentences.zh: 不曰堅乎，磨而不磷；

translations.literal: Does it not say firm, ground but not worn;

sentences.zh: 不曰白乎，涅而不淄。

translations.literal: does it not say white, dyed but not blackened.

sentences.zh: 我豈匏瓜也哉，焉能系而不食？」

translations.literal: Am I a bitter gourd, how can I hang without being eaten?'

Fo Xi was magistrate of Zhongmu. Zhao Jian Zi attacked Fan and Zhong Xing, attacked Zhongmu. Fo Xi rebelled, sent someone to summon Confucius. Confucius wished to go. Zi Lu said: 'I heard from the master, "Gentlemen do not enter where those who personally do evil are." Now Fo Xi personally rebels with Zhongmu, master wishes to go, how is this?' Confucius said: 'There are these words. Does it not say firm, ground but not worn; does it not say white, dyed but not blackened. Am I a bitter gourd, how can I hang without being eaten?'

sentences.zh: 孔子擊磬。

translations.literal: Confucius played the chime.

sentences.zh: 有荷蕢而過門者，曰：「有心哉，擊磬乎！

translations.literal: Someone carrying a hoe passed the gate, said: 'There is purpose here, playing the chime!

sentences.zh: 硜硜乎，莫己知也夫而已矣！」

translations.literal: Clang clang, none know me, that's all!'
Confucius played the chime. Someone carrying a hoe passed the gate, said: 'There is purpose here, playing the chime! Clang clang, none know me, that's all!'

sentences.zh: 孔子學鼓琴師襄子，十日不進。

translations.literal: Confucius studied playing the lute with Master Xiang Zi, ten days without progressing.

sentences.zh: 師襄子曰：「可以益矣。」

translations.literal: Master Xiang Zi said: 'You can add to it.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「丘已習其曲矣，未得其數也。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'I have practiced the melody, but have not gotten its rhythm.'

sentences.zh: 有間，曰：「已習其數，可以益矣。」

translations.literal: After a while, said: 'Have practiced the rhythm, you can add to it.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「丘未得其志也。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'I have not gotten its intent.'

sentences.zh: 有間，曰：「已習其志，可以益矣。」

translations.literal: After a while, said: 'Have gotten the intent, you can add to it.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「丘未得其為人也。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'I have not gotten the person.'

sentences.zh: 有間，［曰］有所穆然深思焉，有所怡然高望而遠志焉。

translations.literal: After a while, there was something solemn and deep in thought, something cheerful and gazing high with far-reaching ambition.

sentences.zh: 曰：「丘得其為人，黯然而黑，幾然而長，眼如望羊，如王四國，非文王其誰能為此也！」

translations.literal: Said: 'I have gotten the person, dark and black, tall and long, eyes like gazing sheep, like ruling the four directions, who but King Wen could do this!'

sentences.zh: 師襄子辟席再拜，曰：「師蓋云文王操也。」

translations.literal: Master Xiang Zi moved his mat and bowed twice, said: 'The master indeed said it is King Wen's piece.'

Confucius studied playing the lute with Master Xiang Zi, ten days without progressing. Master Xiang Zi said: 'You can add to it.' Confucius said: 'I have practiced the melody, but have not gotten its rhythm.' After a while, said: 'Have practiced the rhythm, you can add to it.' Confucius said: 'I have not gotten its intent.' After a while, said: 'Have gotten the intent, you can add to it.' Confucius said: 'I have not gotten the person.' After a while, there was something solemn and deep in thought, something cheerful and gazing high with far-reaching ambition. Said: 'I have gotten the person, dark and black, tall and long, eyes like gazing sheep, like ruling the four directions, who but King Wen could do this!' Master Xiang Zi moved his mat and bowed twice, said: 'The master indeed said it is King Wen's piece.'

sentences.zh: 孔子既不得用於衛，將西見趙簡子。

translations.literal: Confucius having been unable to be employed in Wei, was about to go west to see Zhao Jian Zi.

sentences.zh: 至於河而聞竇鳴犢、舜華之死也，臨河而嘆曰：「美哉水，洋洋乎！

translations.literal: Reached the river and heard of Dou Ming Du and Shun Hua's deaths, by the river sighed: 'Beautiful indeed water, vast!

sentences.zh: 丘之不濟此，命也夫！」

translations.literal: My not crossing this, it is fate!'

sentences.zh: 子貢趨而進曰：「敢問何謂也？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong hurried forward: 'May I ask what this means?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「竇鳴犢，舜華，晉國之賢大夫也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Dou Ming Du, Shun Hua, Jin's worthy ministers.

sentences.zh: 趙簡子未得志之時，須此兩人而后從政；

translations.literal: When Zhao Jian Zi had not yet achieved his ambitions, he depended on these two men then conducted affairs;

sentences.zh: 及其已得志，殺之乃從政。

translations.literal: when he had achieved his ambitions, killed them then conducted affairs.

sentences.zh: 丘聞之也：刳胎殺夭，則麒麟不至郊；

translations.literal: I have heard: cut open fetuses and kill the young, then qilin do not come to the suburbs;

sentences.zh: 竭澤涸漁，則蛟龍不合陰陽；

translations.literal: drain ponds and dry up fisheries, then dragons do not harmonize yin and yang;

sentences.zh: 覆巢毀卵，則鳳皇不翔。

translations.literal: overturn nests and destroy eggs, then phoenixes do not soar.

sentences.zh: 何則？

translations.literal: Why is this?'

sentences.zh: 君子諱傷其類也。

translations.literal: Gentlemen avoid harming their kind.

sentences.zh: 夫鳥獸之於不義也尚知辟之，而況乎丘哉！」

translations.literal: Even birds and beasts know to avoid injustice, how much more so I!

sentences.zh: 乃還息乎陬鄉，作為陬操以哀之。

translations.literal: Thus returned and rested in Zou village, composed the Zou melody to mourn him.

sentences.zh: 而反乎衛，入主蘧伯玉家。

translations.literal: Then returned to Wei, entered and stayed at Qu Bo Yu's home.

Confucius having been unable to be employed in Wei, was about to go west to see Zhao Jian Zi. Reached the river and heard of Dou Ming Du and Shun Hua's deaths, by the river sighed: 'Beautiful indeed water, vast! My not crossing this, it is fate!' Zi Gong hurried forward: 'May I ask what this means?' Confucius said: 'Dou Ming Du, Shun Hua, Jin's worthy ministers. When Zhao Jian Zi had not yet achieved his ambitions, he depended on these two men then conducted affairs; when he had achieved his ambitions, killed them then conducted affairs. I have heard: cut open fetuses and kill the young, then qilin do not come to the suburbs; drain ponds and dry up fisheries, then dragons do not harmonize yin and yang; overturn nests and destroy eggs, then phoenixes do not soar. Why is this?' Gentlemen avoid harming their kind. Even birds and beasts know to avoid injustice, how much more so I! Thus returned and rested in Zou village, composed the Zou melody to mourn him. Then returned to Wei, entered and stayed at Qu Bo Yu's home.

sentences.zh: 他日，靈公問兵陳。

translations.literal: Another day, Ling Gong asked about military formations.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「俎豆之事則嘗聞之，軍旅之事未之學也。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Ritual matters I have heard of, military matters I have not studied.'

sentences.zh: 明日，與孔子語，見蜚鴈，仰視之，色不在孔子。

translations.literal: The next day, spoke with Confucius, saw flying geese, gazed up at them, his color was not on Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子遂行，復如陳。

translations.literal: Confucius thus departed, returned to Chen.

Another day, Ling Gong asked about military formations. Confucius said: 'Ritual matters I have heard of, military matters I have not studied.' The next day, spoke with Confucius, saw flying geese, gazed up at them, his color was not on Confucius. Confucius thus departed, returned to Chen.

sentences.zh: 夏，衛靈公卒，立孫輒，是為衛出公。

translations.literal: Summer, Wei Ling Gong died, established grandson Jie, who became Wei Chu Gong.

sentences.zh: 六月，趙鞅內太子蒯聵于戚。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Zhao Yang brought crown prince Kuai Kui inside Qi.

sentences.zh: 陽虎使太子絻，八人衰絰，偽自衛迎者，哭而入，遂居焉。

translations.literal: Yang Hu made the crown prince wear mourning clothes, eight people in mourning attire, falsely as those welcoming from Wei, crying as they entered, thus resided there.

sentences.zh: 冬，蔡遷于州來。

translations.literal: Winter, Cai moved to Zhou Lai.

sentences.zh: 是歲魯哀公三年，而孔子年六十矣。

translations.literal: This year was Lu Ai Gong's third year, Confucius was sixty years old.

sentences.zh: 齊助衛圍戚，以衛太子蒯聵在故也。

translations.literal: Qi helped Wei besiege Qi because crown prince Kuai Kui was there.

Summer, Wei Ling Gong died, established grandson Jie, who became Wei Chu Gong. Sixth month, Zhao Yang brought crown prince Kuai Kui inside Qi. Yang Hu made the crown prince wear mourning clothes, eight people in mourning attire, falsely as those welcoming from Wei, crying as they entered, thus resided there. Winter, Cai moved to Zhou Lai. This year was Lu Ai Gong's third year, Confucius was sixty years old. Qi helped Wei besiege Qi because crown prince Kuai Kui was there.

sentences.zh: 夏，魯桓釐廟燔，南宮敬叔救火。

translations.literal: Summer, Lu Huan Xi temple burned, Nan Gong Jing Shu saved the fire.

sentences.zh: 孔子在陳，聞之，曰：「災必於桓釐廟乎？」

translations.literal: Confucius in Chen heard of it, said: 'The disaster must be at Huan Xi temple?'

sentences.zh: 已而果然。

translations.literal: Soon indeed so.
Summer, Lu Huan Xi temple burned, Nan Gong Jing Shu saved the fire. Confucius in Chen heard of it, said: 'The disaster must be at Huan Xi temple?' Soon indeed so.

sentences.zh: 秋，季桓子病，輦而見魯城，喟然嘆曰：「昔此國幾興矣，以吾獲罪於孔子，故不興也。」

translations.literal: Autumn, Ji Huan Zi fell ill and was carried to view Lu's city walls. He sighed deeply, saying: 'In the past this state was nearly prosperous, but because I offended Confucius, it did not prosper.'

sentences.zh: 顧謂其嗣康子曰：「我即死，若必相魯；

translations.literal: Looking back at his heir Kang Zi said: 'I will die soon, you must govern Lu;

sentences.zh: 相魯，必召仲尼。」

translations.literal: governing Lu, must summon Zhong Ni.'

sentences.zh: 後數日，桓子卒，康子代立。

translations.literal: After several days, Huan Zi died, Kang Zi succeeded.

sentences.zh: 已葬，欲召仲尼。

translations.literal: After burial, wished to summon Zhong Ni.

sentences.zh: 公之魚曰：「昔吾先君用之不終，終為諸侯笑。

translations.literal: Gong Yu Yu said: 'In the past our former lord employed him but not to the end, finally became the laughingstock of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 今又用之，不能終，是再為諸侯笑。」

translations.literal: Now employing him again, if cannot finish, this is again becoming the laughingstock of the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 康子曰：「則誰召而可？」

translations.literal: Kang Zi said: 'Then who can be summoned?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「必召冉求。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Must summon Ran Qiu.'

sentences.zh: 於是使使召冉求。

translations.literal: Thus sent envoys to summon Ran Qiu.

sentences.zh: 冉求將行，孔子曰：「魯人召求，非小用之，將大用之也。」

translations.literal: Ran Qiu about to go, Confucius said: 'Lu people summon Qiu, not for small use, will greatly use him.'

sentences.zh: 是日，孔子曰：「歸乎歸乎！

translations.literal: That day, Confucius said: 'Return home! Return home!

sentences.zh: 吾黨之小子狂簡，斐然成章，吾不知所以裁之。」

translations.literal: My party's youths are ardent and simple, their patterns are brilliant, I do not know how to cut them.'

sentences.zh: 子貢知孔子思歸，送冉求，因誡曰「即用，以孔子為招」云。

translations.literal: Zi Gong knew Confucius wished to return, sent Ran Qiu, admonishing to 'if employed, use Confucius as the banner.'

Autumn, Ji Huan Zi fell ill and was carried to view Lu's city walls. He sighed deeply, saying: 'In the past this state was nearly prosperous, but because I offended Confucius, it did not prosper.' Looking back at his heir Kang Zi said: 'I will die soon, you must govern Lu; governing Lu, must summon Zhong Ni.' After several days, Huan Zi died, Kang Zi succeeded. After burial, wished to summon Zhong Ni. Gong Yu Yu said: 'In the past our former lord employed him but not to the end, finally became the laughingstock of the feudal lords. Now employing him again, if cannot finish, this is again becoming the laughingstock of the feudal lords.' Kang Zi said: 'Then who can be summoned?' Said: 'Must summon Ran Qiu.' Thus sent envoys to summon Ran Qiu. Ran Qiu about to go, Confucius said: 'Lu people summon Qiu, not for small use, will greatly use him.' That day, Confucius said: 'Return home! Return home! My party's youths are ardent and simple, their patterns are brilliant, I do not know how to cut them.' Zi Gong knew Confucius wished to return, sent Ran Qiu, admonishing to 'if employed, use Confucius as the banner.'

sentences.zh: 冉求既去，明年，孔子自陳遷于蔡。

translations.literal: Ran Qiu having left, next year, Confucius from Chen moved to Cai.

sentences.zh: 蔡昭公將如吳，吳召之也。

translations.literal: Cai Zhao Gong about to go to Wu, Wu summoned him.

sentences.zh: 前昭公欺其臣遷州來，後將往，大夫懼復遷，公孫翩射殺昭公。

translations.literal: Previously Zhao Gong deceived his ministers to move Zhou Lai, now about to go, ministers feared he would move again, Gong Sun Pian shot and killed Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 楚侵蔡。

translations.literal: Chu invaded Cai.

sentences.zh: 秋，齊景公卒。

translations.literal: Autumn, Qi Jing Gong died.

Ran Qiu having left, next year, Confucius from Chen moved to Cai. Cai Zhao Gong about to go to Wu, Wu summoned him. Previously Zhao Gong deceived his ministers to move Zhou Lai, now about to go, ministers feared he would move again, Gong Sun Pian shot and killed Zhao Gong. Chu invaded Cai. Autumn, Qi Jing Gong died.

sentences.zh: 明年，孔子自蔡如葉。

translations.literal: Next year, Confucius from Cai went to Ye.

sentences.zh: 葉公問政，孔子曰：「政在來遠附邇。」

translations.literal: Ye Gong asked about governance, Confucius said: 'Governance lies in attracting the distant and attaching the near.'

sentences.zh: 他日，葉公問孔子於子路，子路不對。

translations.literal: Another day, Ye Gong asked Confucius to Zi Lu, Zi Lu did not answer.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞之，曰：「由，爾何不對曰『其為人也，學道不倦，誨人不厭，發憤忘食，樂以忘憂，不知老之將至』云爾。」

translations.literal: Confucius heard of it, said: 'You, why not answer saying "His character is: studies the Way without tiring, teaches others without wearying, becomes indignant and forgets food, joyful and forgets worry, does not know old age is approaching" thus.'

Next year, Confucius from Cai went to Ye. Ye Gong asked about governance, Confucius said: 'Governance lies in attracting the distant and attaching the near.' Another day, Ye Gong asked Confucius to Zi Lu, Zi Lu did not answer. Confucius heard of it, said: 'You, why not answer saying "His character is: studies the Way without tiring, teaches others without wearying, becomes indignant and forgets food, joyful and forgets worry, does not know old age is approaching" thus.'

sentences.zh: 去葉，反于蔡。

translations.literal: Left Ye, returned to Cai.

sentences.zh: 長沮、桀溺耦而耕，孔子以為隱者，使子路問津焉。

translations.literal: Chang Ju and Jie Ni were plowing together, Confucius considered them recluses, sent Zi Lu to ask for directions.

sentences.zh: 長沮曰：「彼執輿者為誰？」

translations.literal: Chang Ju said: 'That one holding the reins, who is he?'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「為孔丘。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Kong Qiu.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「是魯孔丘與？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Is he Lu Kong Qiu?'
Said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「是知津矣。」

translations.literal: Said: 'He knows the directions.'

sentences.zh: 桀溺謂子路曰：「子為誰？」

translations.literal: Jie Ni told Zi Lu: 'Who are you?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「為仲由。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Zhong You.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「子，孔丘之徒與？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Are you Kong Qiu's disciple?'
Said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 桀溺曰：「悠悠者天下皆是也，而誰以易之？

translations.literal: Jie Ni said: 'The whole world is flooded, who can change it?

sentences.zh: 且與其從辟人之士，豈若從辟世之士哉！」

translations.literal: Rather than follow those who avoid certain people, better to follow those who avoid the world!'

sentences.zh: 耰而不輟。

translations.literal: Planted his hoe and would not speak.

sentences.zh: 子路以告孔子，孔子憮然曰：「鳥獸不可與同群。

translations.literal: Zi Lu returned and told Confucius, Confucius sadly said: 'One cannot herd with birds and beasts.

sentences.zh: 天下有道，丘不與易也。」

translations.literal: If the world has the Way, I will not change it.'

Left Ye, returned to Cai. Chang Ju and Jie Ni were plowing together, Confucius considered them recluses, sent Zi Lu to ask for directions. Chang Ju said: 'That one holding the reins, who is he?' Zi Lu said: 'Kong Qiu.' Said: 'Is he Lu Kong Qiu?' Said: 'Yes.' Said: 'He knows the directions.' Jie Ni told Zi Lu: 'Who are you?' Said: 'Zhong You.' Said: 'Are you Kong Qiu's disciple?' Said: 'Yes.' Jie Ni said: 'The whole world is flooded, who can change it? Rather than follow those who avoid certain people, better to follow those who avoid the world!' Planted his hoe and would not speak. Zi Lu returned and told Confucius, Confucius sadly said: 'One cannot herd with birds and beasts. If the world has the Way, I will not change it.'

sentences.zh: 他日，子路行，遇荷蓧丈人，曰：「子見夫子乎？」

translations.literal: Another day, Zi Lu was walking, encountered an old man carrying a hoe, said: 'Have you seen my master?'

sentences.zh: 丈人曰：「四體不勤，五穀不分，孰為夫子！」

translations.literal: The old man said: 'Your four limbs are not diligent, five grains not distinguished, who is your master!'

sentences.zh: 植其杖而芸。

translations.literal: Planted his staff and weeded.

sentences.zh: 子路以告，孔子曰：「隱者也。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu returned and told Confucius, Confucius said: 'A recluse.'

sentences.zh: 復往，則亡。

translations.literal: Went back again, but he had left.

Another day, Zi Lu was walking, encountered an old man carrying a hoe, said: 'Have you seen my master?' The old man said: 'Your four limbs are not diligent, five grains not distinguished, who is your master!' Planted his staff and weeded. Zi Lu returned and told Confucius, Confucius said: 'A recluse.' Went back again, but he had left.

sentences.zh: 孔子遷于蔡三歲，吳伐陳。

translations.literal: Confucius stayed in Cai three years, Wu attacked Chen.

sentences.zh: 楚救陳，軍于城父。

translations.literal: Chu rescued Chen, camped at Cheng Fu.

sentences.zh: 聞孔子在陳蔡之間，楚使人聘孔子。

translations.literal: Heard Confucius was between Chen and Cai, Chu sent someone to invite Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子將往拜禮，陳蔡大夫謀曰：「孔子賢者，所刺譏皆中諸侯之疾。

translations.literal: Confucius was about to go and perform the ritual visit, Chen and Cai ministers plotted: 'Confucius is worthy, his criticisms all hit the feudal lords' illnesses.

sentences.zh: 今者久留陳蔡之間，諸大夫所設行皆非仲尼之意。

translations.literal: Now he has stayed long between Chen and Cai, all the conduct set by the ministers is not according to Zhong Ni's intent.

sentences.zh: 今楚，大國也，來聘孔子。

translations.literal: Now Chu is a great state, comes to invite Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子用於楚，則陳蔡用事大夫危矣。」

translations.literal: If Confucius is employed in Chu, then Chen and Cai's governing ministers will be in danger.'

sentences.zh: 於是乃相與發徒役圍孔子於野。

translations.literal: Thus together raised laborers and surrounded Confucius in the wilds.

sentences.zh: 不得行，絕糧。

translations.literal: Could not proceed, cut off provisions.

sentences.zh: 從者病，莫能興。

translations.literal: Followers were ill, none could rise.

sentences.zh: 孔子講誦弦歌不衰。

translations.literal: Confucius lectured and recited, played strings and sang without decline.

sentences.zh: 子路慍見曰：「君子亦有窮乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Lu indignantly appeared, said: 'Do gentlemen also have poverty?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「君子固窮，小人窮斯濫矣。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Gentlemen are indeed poor, petty men when poor then become unruly.'

Confucius stayed in Cai three years, Wu attacked Chen. Chu rescued Chen, camped at Cheng Fu. Heard Confucius was between Chen and Cai, Chu sent someone to invite Confucius. Confucius was about to go and perform the ritual visit, Chen and Cai ministers plotted: 'Confucius is worthy, his criticisms all hit the feudal lords' illnesses. Now he has stayed long between Chen and Cai, all the conduct set by the ministers is not according to Zhong Ni's intent. Now Chu is a great state, comes to invite Confucius. If Confucius is employed in Chu, then Chen and Cai's governing ministers will be in danger.' Thus together raised laborers and surrounded Confucius in the wilds. Could not proceed, cut off provisions. Followers were ill, none could rise. Confucius lectured and recited, played strings and sang without decline. Zi Lu indignantly appeared, said: 'Do gentlemen also have poverty?' Confucius said: 'Gentlemen are indeed poor, petty men when poor then become unruly.'

sentences.zh: 子貢色作。

translations.literal: Zi Gong's color changed.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「賜，爾以予為多學而識之者與？」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Ci, do you take me for one who has learned much and knows it?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「然。

translations.literal: Said: 'Yes.

sentences.zh: 非與？」

translations.literal: Is it not so?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「非也。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Not so.

sentences.zh: 予一以貫之。」

translations.literal: I unify it with one.'
Zi Gong's color changed. Confucius said: 'Ci, do you take me for one who has learned much and knows it?' Said: 'Yes. Is it not so?' Confucius said: 'Not so. I unify it with one.'

sentences.zh: 孔子知弟子有慍心，乃召子路而問曰：「《詩》云『匪兕匪虎，率彼曠野』。

translations.literal: Confucius knew his disciples had resentful hearts, thus summoned Zi Lu and asked: 'The Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness".

sentences.zh: 吾道非邪？

translations.literal: Is my Way not right?

sentences.zh: 吾何為於此？」

translations.literal: Why am I here?'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「意者吾未仁邪？

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Perhaps we are not yet benevolent?

sentences.zh: 人之不我信也。

translations.literal: People do not trust me.

sentences.zh: 意者吾未知邪？
