translations.literal: Perhaps we do not yet know?

sentences.zh: 人之不我行也。」

translations.literal: People do not practice it.'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「有是乎！

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'There are these words!

sentences.zh: 由，譬使仁者而必信，安有伯夷、叔齊？

translations.literal: You, supposing benevolent people must be trusted, how would there be Bo Yi and Shu Qi?

sentences.zh: 使知者而必行，安有王子比干？」

translations.literal: Supposing knowledgeable people must be practiced, how would there be Prince Bi Gan?'

Confucius knew his disciples had resentful hearts, thus summoned Zi Lu and asked: 'The Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness". Is my Way not right? Why am I here?' Zi Lu said: 'Perhaps we are not yet benevolent? People do not trust me. Perhaps we do not yet know? People do not practice it.' Confucius said: 'There are these words! You, supposing benevolent people must be trusted, how would there be Bo Yi and Shu Qi? Supposing knowledgeable people must be practiced, how would there be Prince Bi Gan?'

sentences.zh: 子路出，子貢入見。

translations.literal: Zi Lu went out, Zi Gong entered to see.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「賜，《詩》云『匪兕匪虎，率彼曠野』。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Ci, the Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness".

sentences.zh: 吾道非邪？

translations.literal: Is my Way not right?

sentences.zh: 吾何為於此？」

translations.literal: Why am I here?'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子之道至大也，故天下莫能容夫子。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'The Master's Way is extremely great, therefore All Under Heaven cannot contain the Master.

sentences.zh: 夫子蓋少貶焉？」

translations.literal: The Master should perhaps lower himself a bit?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「賜，良農能稼而不能為穡，良工能巧而不能為順。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Ci, good farmers can plant but cannot harvest, good craftsmen can be skillful but cannot be compliant.

sentences.zh: 君子能脩其道，綱而紀之，統而理之，而不能為容。

translations.literal: Gentlemen can cultivate their Way, outline and record it, unify and govern it, but cannot make accommodation.

sentences.zh: 今爾不脩爾道而求為容。

translations.literal: Now you do not cultivate your Way but seek accommodation.

sentences.zh: 賜，而志不遠矣！」

translations.literal: Ci, your ambitions are not far-reaching!'

Zi Lu went out, Zi Gong entered to see. Confucius said: 'Ci, the Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness". Is my Way not right? Why am I here?' Zi Gong said: 'The Master's Way is extremely great, therefore All Under Heaven cannot contain the Master. The Master should perhaps lower himself a bit?' Confucius said: 'Ci, good farmers can plant but cannot harvest, good craftsmen can be skillful but cannot be compliant. Gentlemen can cultivate their Way, outline and record it, unify and govern it, but cannot make accommodation. Now you do not cultivate your Way but seek accommodation. Ci, your ambitions are not far-reaching!'

sentences.zh: 子貢出，顏回入見。

translations.literal: Zi Gong went out, Yan Hui entered to see.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「回，《詩》云『匪兕匪虎，率彼曠野』。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Hui, the Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness".

sentences.zh: 吾道非邪？

translations.literal: Is my Way not right?

sentences.zh: 吾何為於此？」

translations.literal: Why am I here?'

sentences.zh: 顏回曰：「夫子之道至大，故天下莫能容。

translations.literal: Yan Hui said: 'The Master's Way is extremely great, therefore All Under Heaven cannot contain it.

sentences.zh: 雖然，夫子推而行之，不容何病，不容然後見君子！

translations.literal: Although this is so, the Master pushes forward and practices it, not being contained is no illness, not being contained then sees the gentleman!

sentences.zh: 夫道之不修也，是吾醜也。

translations.literal: The Way not being cultivated is our shame.

sentences.zh: 夫道既已大修而不用，是有國者之醜也。

translations.literal: The Way having been greatly cultivated yet not employed is the shame of those who have states.

sentences.zh: 不容何病，不容然後見君子！」

translations.literal: Not being contained is no illness, not being contained then sees the gentleman!'

sentences.zh: 孔子欣然而笑曰：「有是哉顏氏之子！

translations.literal: Confucius smiled happily, said: 'There are such words, Yan family's son!

sentences.zh: 使爾多財，吾為爾宰。」

translations.literal: If you had much wealth, I would be your steward.'

Zi Gong went out, Yan Hui entered to see. Confucius said: 'Hui, the Poetry says "Not rhinoceros not tiger, following that wilderness". Is my Way not right? Why am I here?' Yan Hui said: 'The Master's Way is extremely great, therefore All Under Heaven cannot contain it. Although this is so, the Master pushes forward and practices it, not being contained is no illness, not being contained then sees the gentleman! The Way not being cultivated is our shame. The Way having been greatly cultivated yet not employed is the shame of those who have states. Not being contained is no illness, not being contained then sees the gentleman!' Confucius smiled happily, said: 'There are such words, Yan family's son! If you had much wealth, I would be your steward.'

sentences.zh: 於是使子貢至楚。

translations.literal: Thus sent Zi Gong to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚昭王興師迎孔子，然後得免。

translations.literal: Chu Zhao Wang raised troops to welcome Confucius, then obtained release.
Thus sent Zi Gong to Chu. Chu Zhao Wang raised troops to welcome Confucius, then obtained release.

sentences.zh: 昭王將以書社地七百里封孔子。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang wished to enfeoff Confucius with seven hundred li of book land.

sentences.zh: 楚令尹子西曰：「王之使使諸侯有如子貢者乎？」

translations.literal: Chu prime minister Zi Xi said: 'The king's envoys to feudal lords have ones like Zi Gong?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None have.'

sentences.zh: 「王之輔相有如顏回者乎？」

translations.literal: 'The king's assistants and ministers have ones like Yan Hui?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None have.'

sentences.zh: 「王之將率有如子路者乎？」

translations.literal: 'The king's generals have ones like Zi Lu?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None have.'

sentences.zh: 「王之官尹有如宰予者乎？」

translations.literal: 'The king's officials have ones like Zai Yu?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None have.'

sentences.zh: 「且楚之祖封於周，號為子男五十里。

translations.literal: 'Moreover Chu's ancestors were enfeoffed by Zhou, numbered as zi and nan with fifty li.

sentences.zh: 今孔丘述三五之法，明周召之業，王若用之，則楚安得世世堂堂方數千里乎？

translations.literal: Now Kong Qiu expounds the laws of the Three and Five, clarifies Zhou and Shao's achievements, the king if employs him, then how can Chu generation after generation maintain its grandness of several thousand li?

sentences.zh: 夫文王在豐，武王在鎬，百里之君卒王天下。

translations.literal: King Wen was in Feng, King Wu in Hao, lords of one hundred li ultimately became kings of All Under Heaven.

sentences.zh: 今孔丘得據土壤，賢弟子為佐，非楚之福也。」

translations.literal: Now if Kong Qiu obtains land, with worthy disciples as aides, it is not Chu's fortune.'

sentences.zh: 昭王乃止。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang thus stopped.

sentences.zh: 其秋，楚昭王卒于城父。

translations.literal: That autumn, Chu Zhao Wang died at Cheng Fu.

Zhao Wang wished to enfeoff Confucius with seven hundred li of book land. Chu prime minister Zi Xi said: 'The king's envoys to feudal lords have ones like Zi Gong?' Said: 'None have.' 'The king's assistants and ministers have ones like Yan Hui?' Said: 'None have.' 'The king's generals have ones like Zi Lu?' Said: 'None have.' 'The king's officials have ones like Zai Yu?' Said: 'None have.' 'Moreover Chu's ancestors were enfeoffed by Zhou, numbered as zi and nan with fifty li. Now Kong Qiu expounds the laws of the Three and Five, clarifies Zhou and Shao's achievements, the king if employs him, then how can Chu generation after generation maintain its grandness of several thousand li? King Wen was in Feng, King Wu in Hao, lords of one hundred li ultimately became kings of All Under Heaven. Now if Kong Qiu obtains land, with worthy disciples as aides, it is not Chu's fortune.' Zhao Wang thus stopped. That autumn, Chu Zhao Wang died at Cheng Fu.

sentences.zh: 楚狂接輿歌而過孔子曰：「鳳兮！

translations.literal: The Chu madman Jie Yu sang as he passed Confucius, saying: 'Phoenix!

sentences.zh: 鳳兮！

translations.footnote: Translator's note: In Chinese classical poetry and philosophy, the phoenix (鳳) symbolizes virtue, wisdom, and the worthy ruler. Jie Yu addresses Confucius as a phoenix - a noble being seeking a virtuous lord in a decadent age.
translations.literal: Phoenix!

sentences.zh: 何德之衰？

translations.literal: Why has virtue declined?

sentences.zh: 往者不可諫兮，來者猶可追也！

translations.literal: The past cannot be admonished, the future can still be pursued!

sentences.zh: 已而，已而！

translations.literal: Enough, enough!

sentences.zh: 今之從政者殆而！」

translations.literal: Those who govern today are in peril!'

sentences.zh: 孔子下，欲與之言。

translations.literal: Confucius descended, wished to speak with him.

sentences.zh: 趨而去，弗得與之言。

translations.literal: He hurried away, could not speak with him.

The Chu madman Jie Yu sang as he passed Confucius, saying: 'Phoenix! Phoenix! Why has virtue declined? The past cannot be admonished, the future can still be pursued! Enough, enough! Those who govern today are in peril!' Confucius descended, wished to speak with him. He hurried away, could not speak with him.

sentences.zh: 於是孔子自楚反乎衛。

translations.literal: Thus Confucius from Chu returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 是歲也，孔子年六十三，而魯哀公六年也。

translations.literal: This year, Confucius was sixty-three, Lu Ai Gong's sixth year.
Thus Confucius from Chu returned to Wei. This year, Confucius was sixty-three, Lu Ai Gong's sixth year.

sentences.zh: 其明年，吳與魯會繒，徵百牢。

translations.literal: The next year, Wu and Lu met at Zong, demanded one hundred cattle.

sentences.zh: 太宰嚭召季康子。

translations.literal: Grand Steward Kuai summoned Ji Kang Zi.

sentences.zh: 康子使子貢往，然後得已。

translations.literal: Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to go, then was relieved.
The next year, Wu and Lu met at Zong, demanded one hundred cattle. Grand Steward Kuai summoned Ji Kang Zi. Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to go, then was relieved.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「魯衛之政，兄弟也。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Lu and Wei's governance are like brothers.'

sentences.zh: 是時，衛君輒父不得立，在外，諸侯數以為讓。

translations.literal: At this time, Wei lord Jie Fu could not be established, was outside, feudal lords frequently reproached for it.

sentences.zh: 而孔子弟子多仕於衛，衛君欲得孔子為政。

translations.literal: Confucius's disciples many served in Wei, Wei lord wished to get Confucius for governance.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「衛君待子而為政，子將奚先？」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Wei lord awaits master for governance, what will master put first?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「必也正名乎！」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Certainly rectifying names!'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「有是哉，子之迂也！

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Is there such a thing! Master's pedantry!

sentences.zh: 何其正也？」

translations.literal: How proper is it?'

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「野哉由也！

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Rustic indeed are you!

sentences.zh: 夫名不正則言不順，言不順則事不成，事不成則禮樂不興，禮樂不興則刑罰不中，刑罰不中則民無所錯手足矣。

translations.literal: If names are not correct then speech is not orderly, speech not orderly then affairs are not accomplished, affairs not accomplished then ritual and music do not flourish, ritual and music not flourishing then punishments are not appropriate, punishments not appropriate then people have nowhere to put hand and foot.

sentences.zh: 夫君子為之必可名，言之必可行。

translations.literal: Gentlemen make it certainly nameable, speak it certainly practicable.

sentences.zh: 君子於其言，無所苟而已矣。」

translations.literal: Gentlemen regarding their words have nothing careless.'

Confucius said: 'Lu and Wei's governance are like brothers.' At this time, Wei lord Jie Fu could not be established, was outside, feudal lords frequently reproached for it. Confucius's disciples many served in Wei, Wei lord wished to get Confucius for governance. Zi Lu said: 'Wei lord awaits master for governance, what will master put first?' Confucius said: 'Certainly rectifying names!' Zi Lu said: 'Is there such a thing! Master's pedantry! How proper is it?' Confucius said: 'Rustic indeed are you! If names are not correct then speech is not orderly, speech not orderly then affairs are not accomplished, affairs not accomplished then ritual and music do not flourish, ritual and music not flourishing then punishments are not appropriate, punishments not appropriate then people have nowhere to put hand and foot. Gentlemen make it certainly nameable, speak it certainly practicable. Gentlemen regarding their words have nothing careless.'

sentences.zh: 其明年，冉有為季氏將師，與齊戰於郎，克之。

translations.literal: The next year, Ran You served as Ji family general, fought Qi at Lang, conquered them.

sentences.zh: 季康子曰：「子之於軍旅，學之乎？

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi said: 'Regarding military affairs, did you learn it?

sentences.zh: 性之乎？」

translations.literal: Is it natural?'

sentences.zh: 冉有曰：「學之於孔子。」

translations.literal: Ran You said: 'Learned it from Confucius.'

sentences.zh: 季康子曰：「孔子何如人哉？」

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi said: 'What kind of person is Confucius?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「用之有名；

translations.literal: Replied: 'Employing him brings fame;

sentences.zh: 播之百姓，質諸鬼神而無憾。

translations.literal: broadcast to the people, tested against ghosts and spirits without regret.

sentences.zh: 求之至於此道，雖累千社，夫子不利也。」

translations.literal: Seeking to the utmost this Way, though burdening a thousand altars, the Master would not take profit.'

sentences.zh: 康子曰：「我欲召之，可乎？」

translations.literal: Kang Zi said: 'I wish to summon him, may I?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「欲召之，則毋以小人固之，則可矣。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Wishing to summon him, then do not restrain him with petty men, then it can be.'

sentences.zh: 而衛孔文子將攻太叔，問策於仲尼。

translations.literal: Wei Kong Wen Zi was about to attack Tai Shu, asked strategy from Zhong Ni.

sentences.zh: 仲尼辭不知，退而命載而行，曰：「鳥能擇木，木豈能擇鳥乎！」

translations.literal: Zhong Ni declined not knowing, retired and ordered to load the cart and depart, said: 'Birds can choose trees, how can trees choose birds!'

sentences.zh: 文子固止。

translations.literal: Wen Zi firmly stopped him.

sentences.zh: 會季康子逐公華、公賓、公林，以幣迎孔子，孔子歸魯。

translations.literal: Met Ji Kang Zi expel Gong Hua, Gong Bin, Gong Lin, with gifts welcomed Confucius, Confucius returned to Lu.

The next year, Ran You served as Ji family general, fought Qi at Lang, conquered them. Ji Kang Zi said: 'Regarding military affairs, did you learn it? Is it natural?' Ran You said: 'Learned it from Confucius.' Ji Kang Zi said: 'What kind of person is Confucius?' Replied: 'Employing him brings fame; broadcast to the people, tested against ghosts and spirits without regret. Seeking to the utmost this Way, though burdening a thousand altars, the Master would not take profit.' Kang Zi said: 'I wish to summon him, may I?' Replied: 'Wishing to summon him, then do not restrain him with petty men, then it can be.' Wei Kong Wen Zi was about to attack Tai Shu, asked strategy from Zhong Ni. Met Ji Kang Zi expel Gong Hua, Gong Bin, Gong Lin, with gifts welcomed Confucius, Confucius returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 孔子之去魯凡十四歲而反乎魯。

translations.literal: Confucius's departure from Lu was fourteen years in total when he returned to Lu.
Confucius's departure from Lu was fourteen years in total when he returned to Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯哀公問政，對曰：「政在選臣。」

translations.literal: Lu Ai Gong asked about governance, replied: 'Governance lies in selecting ministers.'

sentences.zh: 季康子問政，曰：「舉直錯諸枉，則枉者直。」

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi asked about governance, said: 'Raise the straight and place over the crooked, then the crooked become straight.'

sentences.zh: 康子患盜，孔子曰：「苟子之不欲，雖賞之不竊。」

translations.literal: Kang Zi worried about thieves, Confucius said: 'If you do not desire, though rewarding them they will not steal.'

sentences.zh: 然魯終不能用孔子，孔子亦不求仕。

translations.literal: Yet Lu ultimately could not employ Confucius, Confucius also did not seek office.

Lu Ai Gong asked about governance, replied: 'Governance lies in selecting ministers.' Ji Kang Zi asked about governance, said: 'Raise the straight and place over the crooked, then the crooked become straight.' Kang Zi worried about thieves, Confucius said: 'If you do not desire, though rewarding them they will not steal.' Yet Lu ultimately could not employ Confucius, Confucius also did not seek office.

sentences.zh: 孔子之時，周室微而禮樂廢，詩書缺。

translations.literal: In Confucius's time, Zhou house was weak and ritual music decayed, poetry and documents deficient.

sentences.zh: 追跡三代之禮，序書傳，上紀唐虞之際，下至秦繆，編次其事。

translations.literal: He traced the rituals of the three dynasties, ordered documents and commentaries, above recording from Tang Yu's time, below reaching Qin Mu, edited their affairs.

sentences.zh: 曰：「夏禮吾能言之，杞不足徵也。

translations.literal: Said: 'Xia rituals I can speak of, Qi is insufficient to verify.

sentences.zh: 殷禮吾能言之，宋不足徵也。

translations.literal: Yin rituals I can speak of, Song is insufficient to verify.

sentences.zh: 足，則吾能徵之矣。」

translations.literal: Sufficient, then I can verify them.'

sentences.zh: 觀殷夏所損益，曰：「後雖百世可知也，以一文一質。

translations.literal: Observed Yin and Xia additions and subtractions, said: 'Later though a hundred generations can be known, with one culture one plainness.

sentences.zh: 周監二代，郁郁乎文哉。

translations.literal: Zhou monitored the two dynasties, flourishing with culture!

sentences.zh: 吾從周。」

translations.literal: I follow Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 故《書傳》、《禮記》自孔氏。

translations.literal: Therefore Book Commentaries, Ritual Records are from the Kong family.

In Confucius's time, Zhou house was weak and ritual music decayed, poetry and documents deficient. He traced the rituals of the three dynasties, ordered documents and commentaries, above recording from Tang Yu's time, below reaching Qin Mu, edited their affairs. Said: 'Xia rituals I can speak of, Qi is insufficient to verify. Yin rituals I can speak of, Song is insufficient to verify. Sufficient, then I can verify them.' Observed Yin and Xia additions and subtractions, said: 'Later though a hundred generations can be known, with one culture one plainness. Zhou monitored the two dynasties, flourishing with culture! I follow Zhou.' Therefore Book Commentaries, Ritual Records are from the Kong family.

sentences.zh: 孔子語魯大師：「樂其可知也。

translations.literal: Confucius told Lu Grand Master: 'Music can be known.

sentences.zh: 始作翕如，縱之純如，皦如，繹如也，以成。」

translations.literal: Beginning harmonious like, extending pure like, clear like, continuous like, thus complete.'

sentences.zh: 「吾自衛反魯，然後樂正，雅頌各得其所。」

translations.literal: 'I from Wei returned to Lu, then music was corrected, Ya and Song each obtained their place.'

Confucius told Lu Grand Master: 'Music can be known. Beginning harmonious like, extending pure like, clear like, continuous like, thus complete.' 'I from Wei returned to Lu, then music was corrected, Ya and Song each obtained their place.'

sentences.zh: 古者詩三千餘篇，及至孔子，去其重，取可施於禮義，上采契后稷，中述殷周之盛，至幽厲之缺，始於衽席，故曰「關雎之亂以為風始，鹿鳴為小雅始，文王為大雅始，清廟為頌始」。

translations.literal: Ancient poetry was over three thousand pieces, until Confucius, removed duplicates, took what could be applied to ritual and righteousness, above gathered from Xie and Hou Ji, middle described Yin Zhou's flourishing, to You Li's decline, beginning from bed curtains, thus said 'Guan Ju's disorder begins the feng, Lu Ming begins the little ya, Wen Wang begins the great ya, Qing Miao begins the song'.

sentences.zh: 三百五篇孔子皆弦歌之，以求合韶武雅頌之音。

translations.literal: Three hundred five pieces Confucius all played on strings and sang, to seek harmony with Shao Wu ya song sounds.

sentences.zh: 禮樂自此可得而述，以備王道，成六藝。

translations.literal: Ritual and music from this can be obtained and expounded, to prepare the kingly way, complete the six arts.

Ancient poetry was over three thousand pieces, until Confucius, removed duplicates, took what could be applied to ritual and righteousness, above gathered from Xie and Hou Ji, middle described Yin Zhou's flourishing, to You Li's decline, beginning from bed curtains, thus said 'Guan Ju's disorder begins the feng, Lu Ming begins the little ya, Wen Wang begins the great ya, Qing Miao begins the song'. Three hundred five pieces Confucius all played on strings and sang, to seek harmony with Shao Wu ya song sounds. Ritual and music from this can be obtained and expounded, to prepare the kingly way, complete the six arts.

sentences.zh: 孔子晚而喜易，序彖、繫、象、說卦、文言。

translations.literal: Confucius late and delighted in Yi, ordered the tuan, xi, xiang, shuo gua, wen yan.

sentences.zh: 讀易，韋編三絕。

translations.literal: Read Yi, leather straps broke three times.

sentences.zh: 曰：「假我數年，若是，我於易則彬彬矣。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Grant me a few more years, thus I at Yi would be refined.'
Confucius late and delighted in Yi, ordered the tuan, xi, xiang, shuo gua, wen yan. Read Yi, leather straps broke three times. Said: 'Grant me a few more years, thus I at Yi would be refined.'

sentences.zh: 孔子以詩書禮樂教，弟子蓋三千焉，身通六藝者七十有二人。

translations.literal: Confucius taught with poetry documents ritual music, disciples altogether three thousand, those proficient in six arts seventy-two persons.

sentences.zh: 如顏濁鄒之徒，頗受業者甚眾。

translations.literal: Like Yan Zhu Zou's group, those who received teaching were very many.

Confucius taught with poetry documents ritual music, disciples altogether three thousand, those proficient in six arts seventy-two persons. Like Yan Zhu Zou's group, those who received teaching were very many.

sentences.zh: 孔子以四教：文，行，忠，信。

translations.literal: Confucius taught four things: culture, conduct, loyalty, faith.

sentences.zh: 絕四：毋意，毋必，毋固，毋我。

translations.literal: Abstained from four: no intention, no certainty, no rigidity, no selfishness.

sentences.zh: 所慎：齊，戰，疾。

translations.literal: What careful: fasting, war, illness.

sentences.zh: 子罕言利與命與仁。

translations.literal: Rarely spoke of profit and fate and benevolence.

sentences.zh: 不憤不啟，舉一隅不以三隅反，則弗復也。

translations.literal: Not indignant not enlightened, lift one corner not using three corners reverse, then not repeat.

Confucius taught four things: culture, conduct, loyalty, faith. Abstained from four: no intention, no certainty, no rigidity, no selfishness. What careful: fasting, war, illness. Rarely spoke of profit and fate and benevolence. Not indignant not enlightened, lift one corner not using three corners reverse, then not repeat.

sentences.zh: 其於鄉黨，恂恂似不能言者。

translations.literal: In his village, cautious like unable to speak.

sentences.zh: 其於宗廟朝廷，辯辯言，唯謹爾。

translations.literal: In ancestral temples and courts, eloquent speech, only careful.

sentences.zh: 朝，與上大夫言，誾誾如也；

translations.literal: At court, speaking with upper ministers, solemn like;

sentences.zh: 與下大夫言，侃侃如也。

translations.literal: speaking with lower ministers, upright like.

In his village, cautious like unable to speak. In ancestral temples and courts, eloquent speech, only careful. At court, speaking with upper ministers, solemn like; speaking with lower ministers, upright like.

sentences.zh: 入公門，鞠躬如也；

translations.literal: Entering the duke's gate, bowing like;

sentences.zh: 趨進，翼如也。

translations.literal: hurrying forward, winged like.

sentences.zh: 君召使儐，色勃如也。

translations.literal: Lord summoned to act as host, color stern like.

sentences.zh: 君命召，不俟駕行矣。

translations.literal: Lord commanded summon, did not wait for harness departed.
Entering the duke's gate, bowing like; hurrying forward, winged like. Lord summoned to act as host, color stern like. Lord commanded summon, did not wait for harness departed.

sentences.zh: 魚餒，肉敗，割不正，不食。

translations.literal: Fish spoiled, meat rotten, cut not proper, not eat.

sentences.zh: 席不正，不坐。

translations.literal: Mat not proper, not sit.

sentences.zh: 食於有喪者之側，未嘗飽也。

translations.literal: Eating at the side of mourners, never full.
Fish spoiled, meat rotten, cut not proper, not eat. Mat not proper, not sit. Eating at the side of mourners, never full.

sentences.zh: 是日哭，則不歌。

translations.literal: That day cried, then not sing.

sentences.zh: 見齊衰、瞽者，雖童子必變。

translations.literal: Seeing mourning garments, blind people, though children must change.
That day cried, then not sing. Seeing mourning garments, blind people, though children must change.

sentences.zh: 「三人行，必得我師。」

translations.literal: 'Three walking, must get my teacher.'

sentences.zh: 「德之不脩，學之不講，聞義不能徙，不善不能改，是吾憂也。」

translations.literal: 'Virtue not cultivated, learning not lectured, hearing righteousness cannot move, not good cannot change, this is my worry.'

sentences.zh: 使人歌，善，則使復之，然后和之。

translations.literal: Made people sing, good, then made repeat, then harmonized with it.

'Three walking, must get my teacher.' 'Virtue not cultivated, learning not lectured, hearing righteousness cannot move, not good cannot change, this is my worry.' Made people sing, good, then made repeat, then harmonized with it.

sentences.zh: 子不語：怪，力，亂，神。

translations.literal: Did not speak of: strange, force, disorder, spirits.
Did not speak of: strange, force, disorder, spirits.

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子之文章，可得聞也。

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'The Master's culture can be heard.

sentences.zh: 夫子言天道與性命，弗可得聞也已。」

translations.literal: The Master speaking of heavenly way and human nature, cannot be heard.'

sentences.zh: 顏淵喟然嘆曰：「仰之彌高，鑽之彌堅。

translations.literal: Yan Yuan sighed deeply: 'Gaze up increasingly high, drill increasingly firm.

sentences.zh: 瞻之在前，忽焉在後。

translations.literal: Look ahead, suddenly behind.

sentences.zh: 夫子循循然善誘人，博我以文，約我以禮，欲罷不能。

translations.literal: The Master step by step skillfully guides people, broadens me with culture, restrains me with ritual, wish to stop cannot.

sentences.zh: 既竭我才，如有所立，卓爾。

translations.literal: Having exhausted my talent, as if standing, outstanding.

sentences.zh: 雖欲從之，蔑由也已。」

translations.literal: Though wish to follow, no way.'

sentences.zh: 達巷黨人［童子］曰：「大哉孔子，博學而無所成名。」

translations.literal: Da Xiang village child said: 'Great indeed Confucius, broadly learned yet has no accomplished name.'

sentences.zh: 子聞之曰：「我何執？

translations.literal: Heard it, said: 'What do I hold?

sentences.zh: 執御乎？

translations.literal: Hold charioteering?

sentences.zh: 執射乎？

translations.literal: Hold archery?

sentences.zh: 我執御矣。」

translations.literal: I hold charioteering.'

sentences.zh: 牢曰：「子云『不試，故藝』。」

translations.literal: Lao said: 'Master said "not tested, thus arts".'

Zi Gong said: 'The Master's culture can be heard. The Master speaking of heavenly way and human nature, cannot be heard.' Yan Yuan sighed deeply: 'Gaze up increasingly high, drill increasingly firm. Look ahead, suddenly behind. The Master step by step skillfully guides people, broadens me with culture, restrains me with ritual, wish to stop cannot. Having exhausted my talent, as if standing, outstanding. Though wish to follow, no way.' Da Xiang village child said: 'Great indeed Confucius, broadly learned yet has no accomplished name.' Heard it, said: 'What do I hold? Hold charioteering? Hold archery? I hold charioteering.' Lao said: 'Master said "not tested, thus arts".'

sentences.zh: 魯哀公十四年春，狩大野。

translations.literal: Lu Ai Gong fourteenth year spring, hunted Great Wilds.

sentences.zh: 叔孫氏車子鉏商獲獸，以為不祥。

translations.literal: Shusun family charioteer Zi Chu Shang captured beast, considered inauspicious.

sentences.zh: 仲尼視之，曰：「麟也。」

translations.literal: Zhong Ni viewed it, said: 'A qilin.'

sentences.zh: 取之。

translations.literal: Took it.

sentences.zh: 曰：「河不出圖，雒不出書，吾已矣夫！」

translations.literal: Said: 'River does not produce diagram, Luo does not produce book, I am finished!'

sentences.zh: 顏淵死，孔子曰：「天喪予！」

translations.literal: Yan Yuan died, Confucius said: 'Heaven destroys me!'

sentences.zh: 及西狩見麟，曰：「吾道窮矣！」

translations.literal: When western hunt saw qilin, said: 'My Way is exhausted!'

sentences.zh: 喟然嘆曰：「莫知我夫！」

translations.literal: Sighed deeply: 'None know me!'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「何為莫知子？」

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'Why none know master?'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「不怨天，不尤人，下學而上達，知我者其天乎！」

translations.literal: Said: 'Not resent heaven, not blame people, study below reach above, those who know me, heaven!'

Lu Ai Gong fourteenth year spring, hunted Great Wilds. Shusun family charioteer Zi Chu Shang captured beast, considered inauspicious. Zhong Ni viewed it, said: 'A qilin.' Took it. Sighed deeply: 'None know me!' Zi Gong said: 'Why none know master?' Said: 'Not resent heaven, not blame people, study below reach above, those who know me, heaven!'

sentences.zh: 「不降其志，不辱其身，伯夷、叔齊乎！」

translations.literal: 'Not lower their will, not disgrace their person, Bo Yi, Shu Qi!'

sentences.zh: 謂「柳下惠、少連降志辱身矣」。

translations.literal: Said 'Liu Xia Hui, Shao Lian lowered will disgraced person.'

sentences.zh: 謂「虞仲、夷逸隱居放言，行中清，廢中權」。

translations.literal: Said 'Yu Zhong, Yi Yi hidden dwelling loose words, conduct midst pure, abandoned midst balance'.

sentences.zh: 「我則異於是，無可無不可。」

translations.literal: 'I then different from this, no can no cannot.'

'Not lower their will, not disgrace their person, Bo Yi, Shu Qi!' Said 'Liu Xia Hui, Shao Lian lowered will disgraced person.' Said 'Yu Zhong, Yi Yi hidden dwelling loose words, conduct midst pure, abandoned midst balance'. 'I then different from this, no can no cannot.'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「弗乎弗乎，君子病沒世而名不稱焉。

translations.literal: Said: 'Alas alas, gentleman grieves dying in age and name not fitting.

sentences.zh: 吾道不行矣，吾何以自見於後世哉？」

translations.literal: My Way not practiced, how can I appear to later generations?'

sentences.zh: 乃因史記作春秋，上至隱公，下訖哀公十四年，十二公。

translations.literal: Thus based on historical records composed Spring and Autumn, above to Yin Gong, below ends Ai Gong fourteenth year, twelve dukes.

sentences.zh: 據魯，親周，故殷，運之三代。

translations.literal: Based on Lu, close to Zhou, thus Yin, moved through three dynasties.

sentences.zh: 約其文辭而指博。

translations.literal: Concised their words pointed broadly.

sentences.zh: 故吳楚之君自稱王，而春秋貶之曰「子」；

translations.literal: Therefore Wu Chu lords self-called kings, but Spring and Autumn demoted them as 'zi';

sentences.zh: 踐土之會實召周天子，而春秋諱之曰「天王狩於河陽」：推此類以繩當世。

translations.literal: Jian Tu meeting actually summoned Zhou Son of Heaven, but Spring and Autumn euphemized as 'Heavenly King hunted at He Yang': push this category to bind the present age.

sentences.zh: 貶損之義，後有王者舉而開之。

translations.literal: Demote damage meanings, later kings will raise and expand them.

sentences.zh: 春秋之義行，則天下亂臣賊子懼焉。

translations.literal: Spring and Autumn meanings practiced, then All Under Heaven's rebellious ministers and villainous sons fear.

Said: 'Alas alas, gentleman grieves dying in age and name not fitting. My Way not practiced, how can I appear to later generations?' Thus based on historical records composed Spring and Autumn, above to Yin Gong, below ends Ai Gong fourteenth year, twelve dukes. Based on Lu, close to Zhou, thus Yin, moved through three dynasties. Concised their words pointed broadly. Therefore Wu Chu lords self-called kings, but Spring and Autumn demoted them as 'zi'; Jian Tu meeting actually summoned Zhou Son of Heaven, but Spring and Autumn euphemized as 'Heavenly King hunted at He Yang': push this category to bind the present age. Demote damage meanings, later kings will raise and expand them. Spring and Autumn meanings practiced, then All Under Heaven's rebellious ministers and villainous sons fear.

sentences.zh: 孔子在位聽訟，文辭有可與人共者，弗獨有也。

translations.literal: Confucius in position heard lawsuits, literary phrases had what could be shared with others, not possessed alone.

sentences.zh: 至於為春秋，筆則筆，削則削，子夏之徒不能贊一辭。

translations.literal: As for composing the Spring and Autumn Annals, what should be written was written, what should be deleted was deleted, even Zi Xia's disciples could not add a single word.

sentences.zh: 弟子受春秋，孔子曰：「後世知丘者以春秋，而罪丘者亦以春秋。」

translations.literal: The disciples received the Spring and Autumn Annals, Confucius said: 'Later generations who know Qiu will do so through the Spring and Autumn Annals, and those who condemn Qiu will also do so through the Spring and Autumn Annals.'

Confucius in position heard lawsuits, literary phrases had what could be shared with others, not possessed alone. As for composing the Spring and Autumn Annals, what should be written was written, what should be deleted was deleted, even Zi Xia's disciples could not add a single word. The disciples received the Spring and Autumn Annals, Confucius said: 'Later generations who know Qiu will do so through the Spring and Autumn Annals, and those who condemn Qiu will also do so through the Spring and Autumn Annals.'

sentences.zh: 明歲，子路死於衛。

translations.literal: The next year, Zi Lu died in Wei.

sentences.zh: 孔子病，子貢請見。

translations.literal: Confucius fell ill, Zi Gong requested to see him.

sentences.zh: 孔子方負杖逍遙於門，曰：「賜，汝來何其晚也？」

translations.literal: Confucius was leaning on his staff strolling at the gate, said: 'Ci, why have you come so late?'

sentences.zh: 孔子因歎，歌曰：「太山壞乎！

translations.literal: Confucius thus sighed, sang: 'Great Mountain collapses!

sentences.zh: 梁柱摧乎！

translations.literal: Rafters break!

sentences.zh: 哲人萎乎！」

translations.literal: Wise man withers!'

sentences.zh: 因以涕下。

translations.literal: Thus tears flowed down.

sentences.zh: 謂子貢曰：「天下無道久矣，莫能宗予。

translations.literal: He told Zi Gong: 'The world has lacked the Way for a long time, none can follow me.

sentences.zh: 夏人殯於東階，周人於西階，殷人兩柱閒。

translations.literal: Xia people encoffined on the eastern steps, Zhou people on the western steps, Yin people between the two pillars.

sentences.zh: 昨暮予夢坐奠兩柱之閒，予始殷人也。」

translations.literal: Last night I dreamed I sat enshrined between the two pillars, I began as a Yin person.'

sentences.zh: 後七日卒。

translations.literal: After seven days he died.

The next year, Zi Lu died in Wei. Confucius fell ill, Zi Gong requested to see him. Confucius was leaning on his staff strolling at the gate, said: 'Ci, why have you come so late?' Confucius thus sighed, sang: 'Great Mountain collapses! Rafters break! Wise man withers!' Thus tears flowed down. He told Zi Gong: 'The world has lacked the Way for a long time, none can follow me. Xia people encoffined on the eastern steps, Zhou people on the western steps, Yin people between the two pillars. Last night I dreamed I sat enshrined between the two pillars, I began as a Yin person.' After seven days he died.

sentences.zh: 孔子年七十三，以魯哀公十六年四月己丑卒。

translations.literal: Confucius was seventy-three years old, died in the fourth month on ji-chou day of Duke Ai of Lu's sixteenth year.
Confucius was seventy-three years old, died in the fourth month on ji-chou day of Duke Ai of Lu's sixteenth year.

sentences.zh: 哀公誄之曰：「旻天不弔，不愸遺一老，俾屏余一人以在位，煢煢余在疚。

translations.literal: Duke Ai eulogized him saying: 'Heaven does not bless, does not pity and leave one elder, causing me alone to remain in position, solitary I am in mourning.

sentences.zh: 嗚呼哀哉！

translations.literal: Alas, alas!

sentences.zh: 尼父，毋自律！」

translations.literal: Ni Father, do not restrain yourself!'

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「君其不沒於魯乎！

translations.literal: Zi Gong said: 'Your lordship will not be forgotten in Lu!

sentences.zh: 夫子之言曰：『禮失則昬，名失則愆。

translations.literal: The Master's words say: "When ritual is lost then confusion, when names are lost then error.

sentences.zh: 失志為昬，失所為愆。』

translations.literal: Losing the will is confusion, losing the place is error."'

sentences.zh: 生不能用，死而誄之，非禮也。

translations.literal: While alive he could not be employed, when dead he is eulogized, this is not ritual.

sentences.zh: 稱『余一人』，非名也。」

translations.literal: Calling himself 'I alone', this is not the name.'

Duke Ai eulogized him saying: 'Heaven does not bless, does not pity and leave one elder, causing me alone to remain in position, solitary I am in mourning. Alas, alas! Ni Father, do not restrain yourself!' Zi Gong said: 'Your lordship will not be forgotten in Lu! The Master's words say: "When ritual is lost then confusion, when names are lost then error. Losing the will is confusion, losing the place is error."' While alive he could not be employed, when dead he is eulogized, this is not ritual. Calling himself 'I alone', this is not the name.'

sentences.zh: 孔子葬魯城北泗上，弟子皆服三年。

translations.literal: Confucius was buried north of Lu city on the Si River, disciples all mourned for three years.

sentences.zh: 三年心喪畢，相訣而去，則哭，各復盡哀；

translations.literal: After three years the mourning in heart was complete, they bid farewell and left, then wept, each exhausting their grief;

sentences.zh: 或復留。

translations.literal: some remained again.

sentences.zh: 唯子貢廬於冢上，凡六年，然後去。

translations.literal: Only Zi Gong built a hut on the tomb, for six years in all, then left.

sentences.zh: 弟子及魯人往從冢而家者百有餘室，因命曰孔里。

translations.literal: Disciples and Lu people who moved to live by the tomb numbered over one hundred households, thus named Kong Village.

sentences.zh: 魯世世相傳以歲時奉祠孔子冢，而諸儒亦講禮鄉飲大射於孔子冢。

translations.literal: Lu generation after generation transmitted to offer sacrifice to Confucius's tomb at the seasons, while Confucian scholars also lectured on ritual, rural feasts, and great archery at Confucius's tomb.

sentences.zh: 孔子冢大一頃。

translations.literal: Confucius's tomb was one qing in size.

sentences.zh: 故所居堂弟子內，後世因廟藏孔子衣冠琴車書，至于漢二百餘年不絕。

translations.literal: Therefore in the hall where he resided among disciples, later generations accordingly made a temple to store Confucius's clothes, hat, zither, chariot, books, continuing to the Han for over two hundred years without cease.

sentences.zh: 高皇帝過魯，以太牢祠焉。

translations.literal: The Supreme Emperor passed through Lu, sacrificed to him with the great offering.

sentences.zh: 諸侯卿相至，常先謁然後從政。

translations.literal: Feudal lords and ministers arriving, always first visited then conducted affairs.

Confucius was buried north of Lu city on the Si River, disciples all mourned for three years. After three years the mourning in heart was complete, they bid farewell and left, then wept, each exhausting their grief; some remained again. sentences.zh: 孔子生鯉，字伯魚。

translations.literal: Confucius fathered Li, styled Bo Yu.

sentences.zh: 伯魚年五十，先孔子死。

translations.literal: Bo Yu at age fifty died before Confucius.
Confucius fathered Li, styled Bo Yu. Bo Yu at age fifty died before Confucius.

sentences.zh: 伯魚生伋，字子思，年六十二。

translations.literal: Bo Yu fathered Ji, styled Zi Si, age sixty-two.

sentences.zh: 嘗困於宋。

translations.literal: Once was besieged in Song.

sentences.zh: 子思作中庸。

translations.literal: Zi Si composed the Doctrine of the Mean.
Bo Yu fathered Ji, styled Zi Si, age sixty-two. Once was besieged in Song. Zi Si composed the Doctrine of the Mean.

sentences.zh: 子思生白，字子上，年四十七。

translations.literal: Zi Si fathered Bai, styled Zi Shang, age forty-seven.

sentences.zh: 子上生求，字子家，年四十五。

translations.literal: Zi Shang fathered Qiu, styled Zi Jia, age forty-five.

sentences.zh: 子家生箕，字子京，年四十六。

translations.literal: Zi Jia fathered Ji, styled Zi Jing, age forty-six.

sentences.zh: 子京生穿，字子高，年五十一。

translations.literal: Zi Jing fathered Chuan, styled Zi Gao, age fifty-one.

sentences.zh: 子高生子慎，年五十七，嘗為魏相。

translations.literal: Zi Gao fathered Chong, styled Zi Gao, age fifty-seven, once served as Wei chancellor.

Zi Si fathered Bai, styled Zi Shang, age forty-seven. Zi Shang fathered Qiu, styled Zi Jia, age forty-five. Zi Jia fathered Ji, styled Zi Jing, age forty-six. Zi Jing fathered Chuan, styled Zi Gao, age fifty-one. Zi Gao fathered Chong, styled Zi Gao, age fifty-seven, once served as Wei chancellor.

sentences.zh: 子慎生鮒，年五十七，為陳王涉博士，死於陳下。

translations.literal: Zi Gao fathered Fu, age fifty-seven, died in Chen serving Chen King Fu as doctor.
Zi Gao fathered Fu, age fifty-seven, died in Chen serving Chen King Fu as doctor.

sentences.zh: 鮒弟子襄，年五十七。

translations.literal: Fu's disciple Xiang, age fifty-seven.

sentences.zh: 嘗為孝惠皇帝博士，遷為長沙太守。

translations.literal: Once served as doctor to Emperor Hui of Han, moved to become governor of Changsha.

sentences.zh: 長九尺六寸。

translations.literal: Nine chi six cun tall.
Fu's disciple Xiang, age fifty-seven. Once served as doctor to Emperor Hui of Han, moved to become governor of Changsha. Nine chi six cun tall.

sentences.zh: 子襄生忠，年五十七。

translations.literal: Zi Xiang fathered Zhong, age fifty-seven.

sentences.zh: 忠生武，武生延年及安國。

translations.literal: Zhong fathered Wu, Wu fathered Yan Nian and An Guo.

sentences.zh: 安國為今皇帝博士，至臨淮太守，蚤卒。

translations.literal: An Guo served as doctor to the current emperor, went to be governor of Linhuai, died young.

sentences.zh: 安國生卬，卬生驩。

translations.literal: An Guo fathered Ang, Ang fathered Huan.

Zi Xiang fathered Zhong, age fifty-seven. Zhong fathered Wu, Wu fathered Yan Nian and An Guo. An Guo served as doctor to the current emperor, went to be governor of Linhuai, died young. An Guo fathered Ang, Ang fathered Huan.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：《詩》有之：「高山仰止，景行行止。」

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: 'The Poetry says: "High mountains look up to them and stop, shining paths walk them and stop."

sentences.zh: 雖不能至，然心鄉往之。

translations.literal: Though unable to reach them, the heart turns toward them.

sentences.zh: 余讀孔氏書，想見其為人。

translations.literal: I read Confucius's books, imagine seeing his person.

sentences.zh: 適魯，觀仲尼廟堂車服禮器，諸生以時習禮其家，余祗回留之不能去云。

translations.literal: Went to Lu, observed Confucius's temple hall carriage robes ritual vessels, the disciples with the times practice ritual in his home, I reverently lingered and could not leave.

sentences.zh: 天下君王至於賢人眾矣，當時則榮，沒則已焉。

translations.literal: The world has many kings and worthy people, when alive they are honored, when dead they end.

sentences.zh: 孔子布衣，傳十餘世，學者宗之。

translations.literal: Confucius as commoner, transmitted for over ten generations, scholars revere him.

sentences.zh: 自天子王侯，中國言六藝者折中於夫子，可謂至聖矣！

translations.literal: From kings and nobles of China, those speaking of the six arts take Confucius as the standard, can be called the utmost sage!'

The Grand Historian says: 'The Poetry says: "High mountains look up to them and stop, shining paths walk them and stop." Though unable to reach them, the heart turns toward them. I read Confucius's books, imagine seeing his person. Went to Lu, observed Confucius's temple hall carriage robes ritual vessels, the disciples with the times practice ritual in his home, I reverently lingered and could not leave. The world has many kings and worthy people, when alive they are honored, when dead they end. Confucius as commoner, transmitted for over ten generations, scholars revere him. From kings and nobles of China, those speaking of the six arts take Confucius as the standard, can be called the utmost sage!'
